reviewTitle: It was great--for about an hour
reviewDescription: Got this vac to replace a 20-year-old Dirt Devil that I use upstairs so I don't have to drag my big, heavy vac up and down the stairs.  It came over the weekend and I didn't have a chance to try it out until today. I have a greyhound and four cats, two of which are long haired.  It is quite maneuverable, relatively light weight--just what I need.  I was very impressed with its ability to pick up the animal hair.  My bedroom rug now looks terrific.  But as I moved into the hall to vacuum, I noticed it was no longer picking up the fur.  On closer examination I realized the brush bar was no longer turning...the belt has apparently snapped.  My rugs are not high pile and I had had no trouble pushing the vac.  I put the box out with the trash this morning, so I no longer have the box in which to return it.  I guess I'll order a new belt and see if I can put it in myself.  Meanwhile, other rooms upstairs continue to accumulate pet hair until I can get this thing back in working order.  I am very sad and disappointed.

I needed a replacement vacuum so badly (ours had been broken for more than week, and we have dogs), so I was so excited to get this new one after reading many positive reviews.  It was easy to assemble and the suction was good enough upon using it the first time - but unfortunately we found that if the very small container gets even 1/4 full, large clumps of hair get caught and wrapped around the filter mechanism at the top, and there is absolutely no way to empty the cannister without having to reach inside and pry all of the dirt and hair out.  It's dirty, messy, and the dust is literally making me sick from being all over me each every time I need to clean/vacuum.  I can't finish even half of a room without having to empty it 3 or 4 times - just to be sure I can dump the dirt out without touching it.  Hair gets wound around the brush very easily as well (although this I had expected), and after each use we have to cut/pull it from the brush mechanism.  I absolutely dread vacuuming now - when in the past it was one of my favorite chores.  For such a great price and with so many good reviews I had a lot of hope for this one, but it is most definitely very low quality and not a good buy.  Do yourself a favor and get something else.

reviewTitle: YGreat vacuum, but my cord was sliced halfway through so i had to wrap it with electrical tape :(
reviewDescription: This vacuum was great at first. I tried it, & loved it the first time. So I threw out the box & everything. The second time I went to use it, I noticed that at the top of the cord, it was sliced about half way through the cord where it came out of the vacuum near the top. I didn't try to return it since I had already got rid of the packaging. I wrapped it with electrical tape & it still gets the job done I guess. I never splurge on myself & I sucks that when I did, this happened. But I missed my 30 days to speak up & return it, which is my fault. Just beware I guess.

Even though we empty it out regularly and make sure nothing is blocked in the hose, wheels or canister it makes a high pitched sound when vacuuming and boy is it annoying. I have to wear my headphones.The suction works good though. I like the different levels to select the floor pile level. I didn't see a way to turn off the rotation brush. I assumed on hard floor setting that the brush would not rotate. Boy was I wrong. It ruined a brand new area rug on the hard floor setting because the beater lifted the pile in tufts.This is also not that lightweight.

reviewTitle: I got a good 4 months out of it until...
reviewDescription: I was excited to get a new vacuum cleaner since I have 2 young kids who love to leave messes all over the house. I used it multiple times a week and the vacuum worked well initially, good suction, useful attachments, easy to maneuver, and lightweight. However after a few months, all of a sudden the vacuum would randomly cut on and off while in use and the suction wasn't nearly as strong. I've only had it 4 months and now I'm already in need of another. This is ridiculous! I definitely won't be purchasing this brand again!!

reviewTitle: One of the worst vacuums I ever had...
reviewDescription: I recently bought the EUREKA PowerSpeed Lightweight Powerful Upright Vacuum Cleaner, and I’m giving it 2 out of 5 stars. Unfortunately, it's one of the worst vacuums I've purchased. While it’s lightweight and easy to maneuver, the suction power is disappointing, and it struggles to pick up even basic dirt and debris.The build quality also feels flimsy, and I doubt it will hold up over time. It’s not completely useless, but it definitely doesn’t live up to its claims. I wouldn’t recommend it if you're looking for a reliable vacuum.

First, the suction is OKAY. Not great. The cord is decidedly too short. The housing is high, and that prohibits you from reaching under beds and low furniture. For a unit with average suction, it is quite heavy and difficult to maneuver. Had Eurekas before. Seems like they were better made.  This is a little too heavy to push around. Basic vacuum, no bells and whistles. I will keep it. I have used it. It does the job, just didn’t leave me smiling.

I purchased this vacuum because it was the #1 sold, but since I’ve gotten it, it’s not really doing a good job. I constantly have to go back over areas 3-4 times because it’s not picking up. It does this thing where after 10 min or so it coughs up what it just swept up and makes a fuzz/hair ball. I’m not having a good time with this one, maybe I have a bad one

This vaccum isn't as impressive as I'd hoped it to be , it doesn't have great suction it missed stuff when vacuuming the hose is short so really useless when needing to use extensions and the handle has an open hole at the top which looks funny and feels strange . I would pass on this unless it's the best you can do at the time

Are you looking for a vacuum that will easily suck up all that fur? Something dependable with a strong suction, and doesn’t clog every time you use it?Then look for a different vacuum because this one isn’t it. The attachment with the brush for furniture barely works either, the best I can say is that my couch doesn’t look AS furry as it did before.
To heavy and big for light vac

I honestly don’t think this vacuum will last very long in our home. It’s made with VERY cheap parts! Not self propelling so you have to work to pull it back towards you when you are completing a row. The hose disconnects as your vacuuming which makes it impossible to work quickly. I do not recommend!

reviewTitle: Huge disappointment vs their older model
reviewDescription: I've had 2 of these in the past and was very happy with them.  That is why I bought another one.  Wow, that was a mistake.They have cheapened this up and sucked every cost cutting penny out of it.  The motor is FAR smaller than on the older one.  The old attachments don't fit on the new hose and the new ones aren't nearly as good.  They saved money by not including extention tubes and replacing them by offering the handle.  This doesn't work at all for close spaces.  It's bulky and very difficult to use.The new model blows around dog hair much more than the old model.  This makes it difficult to properly clean dog hair off hardwood floors.  The dust bin is large enough so that earned it one more start.Overall, DONT BUY THIS.  They've gone too far on cost cutting and it shows.  I am no longer a loyal customer.

reviewTitle: durability and replacement parts seem to be a problem
reviewDescription: I purchased this vacuum (NEU280 series) in Feb. 2022. It worked very well until Early Nov. 2022 when the belt broke. I purchased a replacement belt, but could not find a Eureka belt or equivalent that would stretch enough to allow me to attach it properly. I am a seasoned vacuum belt replacer, and I was worried that using a leverage tool to help get the roller brush back in place would damage the belt pin. So I kept trying to install the belt with manual strength alone. I even purchased a different brand belt with the service manual's recommended part number on it. Then the brushroll broke. Ugh! I looked for a replacement brushroll, but Eureka does not stock them. So much for advertised "newer model." I give up. Although I have always been very satisfied and confident in purchasing Eureka floor care products, I have purchased a new vacuum cleaner that is NOT a Eureka (and have purchased that brand replacement belts as a precaution.)

reviewTitle: Buyer Beware! LIMITED warranty. Be ready to purchase, service & replace the belt every 5 months!
reviewDescription: Most people who write reviews do so too soon. I've had this for less than 6 months and the belt snapped. When I contacted Eureka customer service they asked me a lot of questions and then asked me to take the unit apart and send them a picture of the belt! After 20 minutes of back and forth and taking the unit apart, the belt was indeed broken. Customer service pointed out that belts are NOT covered under warranty and should be replaced every 6 months! However even if your belt breaks the first day you use the thing it's YOUR responsibility to purchase extra belts and repair the unit yourself! DO NOT BE FOOLED by 1 year Limited Warranty like I was. I'd highly recommend SHARK vacuums instead of this brand.

reviewTitle: It didn't really do the job
reviewDescription: When I was using it for the first (and only) time I was vacuuming up some small pieces from the medium-depth carpet. I was on the correct setting. The vacuum would repeatedly shoot out the same pieces of hair, dust bunny, small dusty particles onto the floor. So, no, $90 is not worth that to me. I need the materials to be sucked up and stay there. It is a very light vacuum and that is a very nice feature.
Worked fine for 9 months. Now there is a gap where the dirt chamber meets the tube so it spits out whatever it sucks in. No longer of use

I got this hoping to help the amount of bags I buy for my canister vacuum. Love that it is bagless however in the front of the vacuum it pushes air out so it's blowing things away before I can vacuum it. It does a great job picking up heavy things but dog hair just flies away before the vacuum can get to it. It's easy to clean and easy push. Don't know how durable it is because I just got it.

I’ve had this vacuum for a month. I read the views and the good seemed to out weigh the bad so I decided to go for it. Plus I wanted to find a cheaper vacuum that would work for my pet hair and this is how they advertise it right? Well I’d say it worked fine for the time being, nothing special, I didn’t notice any difference in how it picked up my dog hair though. Some would still be left behind. I did love how lightweight it was but the downfall of that was the cord was short so if I overextended it the whole vacuum came down. The reason I’m leaving this review though is that I’ve used this vacuum only a handful of times, I was just getting ready to use it today, dumped it out to make sure it would have good suction and turn it on, after a few minutes I smell a burning smell and then notice the bottom was smoking. So I shut it off and here I am.

Thought this was going to be better and different than most. It is not. Clean and maintain it regularly and still the motor is getting very loud. Sounds like a jet engine with a whine. The suction too is lessening with each use. Disappointing.

reviewTitle: We Absolutely LOVE This Vacuum – Affordable and Effective!
reviewDescription: My wife and I are thrilled with this vacuum! It works incredibly well, picking up dirt and debris with ease, and leaves our floors spotless every time. The suction power is impressive, and it’s lightweight enough to maneuver around the house without any hassle.The best part is how affordable it was—we couldn’t believe we found such a high-quality vacuum at this price point. It’s made cleaning so much easier and more efficient for both of us. If you’re looking for a reliable vacuum that won’t break the bank, this one is a fantastic choice!

We had a 20-yearold Eureka bagless that broke, and this was the nearest we found. Glad we did! It's a little larger than the broken one, but a bit less large, heavy and cumbersome than our old Hoover upright. And a lot lighter in weight! This one (somehow) came with the extra pet-hair mini roller brush, but I had to go look up the Bissell version on line to find out how to take it apart for cleaning the mini roller. Works the same, and the device is REALLY useful for getting into small places. We have a long-hair cat.With 8 amps, this thing really pulls up dirt! Seriously pulls up dirt! I set it to the low "Carpet" level, for an old shag carpet in the trailer house. I'm living here, but the owner's been here for a long time. I've been cleaning with that old Eureka, and it's (I thought) been pretty clean. I was getting a lot of fuzz, cat hair, and some fine dirt, but all in all, okay. Then I used this guy! Holy Cow!!The first pass after setting it up, there was almost an entire "bucket" container of something greyish-brown. Plus a lot of fuzz and a lot of cat hair. I asked the owner, who told me that many years ago, she'd had a flea problem and sprinkled diatomaceous earth all over. Fixed the fleas, but she never cleaned the carpets.Suddenly, I'm using this new Eureka and it's pulling EVERYthing out of the carpet! After only two times using it (back in April; it's now September), almost all that "dust" was gone. Now, I'm getting general dirt, cat hair, dust and carpet fuzz. Normal.1. After the first-time use, with the massive amount of "newly discovered" dirt, the roller bar was almost entirely clear! No wrapped hair or anything gunked up in the brush bristles. Amazing!2. Disassembling for cleaning, I found that the main vacuum body was almost entirely clean! No outer dust anywhere on the plastic. The only dust was at the connection hole between the body and the container bucket -- easy to clean with a swipe of a sponge or rag.3. Cleaning the container and filter was pretty simple, but a little bit of time involved.Cleaning:A push-button on the top handle releases the catch bin as a complete unit unto itself. There's another button near the bottom of that basin, which then releases a gravity-operated "lid." BE SURE TO KEEP THE BOTTOM OF THE BUCKET WELL BELOW THE UPPER EDGE OF YOUR TRASH CONTAINER!By pushing the release button to open the bottom of the bucket, you're simply dropping out ALL the crud you've picked up in the catch basin! It comes flying out, dust-cloud and all! Still, there's some remaining junk clinging to the clear plastic bucket walls.I like "BANG!" cleaner spray, which is cheap (Dollar Tree), and works very well. I also have a spray attachment on the kitchen sink, which makes it very easy to get water inside the bucket "tube." There's a plastic "clasp" or catch you pull on, to open the top of the overall basin. I'd imagine that catch will eventually break, but who knows.....none of the plastic on the 20-yearold ever broke.With the bottom open and the top hinged back, you can clean the entire catch basin. It's large enough (easily) that you can get your hand in there with a sponge. The BANG! makes it easier, and water rinses it all out.The entire filter section comes apart, which is why I bought this. You lift out the filter assembly (the instruction manual shows how), and there are several parts. The filter itself is foam with some sort of paper on top. It's there to prevent dust from blowing into the motor, and both the bottom (foam) and top (paper) got totally covered with dust. Being gentle with it, I was easily able to clean it under running water.I couldn't find these round filters anywhere in stores, so ordered a 6-pack of replacements on Amazon. Not all that expensive. I've used and cleaned this vacuum now probably 8 times (since April, it's now September), and the filter is still pretty together. I can see it's going to degrade, but if it lasts four months (or more), then I only need to replace it three times a year. Very cost effective. And this place has all the old micro dust along with the cat hair, so the filter has to get cleaned after each use. For "normal people" and their homes, I think you could use the cleaner several times without cleaning every single time.The attachments are all there, easily stored on the body of the machine. The hose attaches to the roller base during upright use, and comes loose to attach to the handle for portable use. DO follow the instruction manual! The places for the attachments, and how to connect the different hose operations aren't immediately obvious.Some people complain that the roller bar always turns. The old Eureka had a 2-way switch for upright (with roller bar), and portable (for smooth floors and portable use). This power switch only is On/Off. I don't care. You can raise the level of the roller for "wood floors," if it really makes you anxious.All in all, having sold vacuum cleaners in the past, I'd have to say this is one of the most powerful machines I've ever seen for its size, weight, and price! Yes, it's all plastic, to keep the weight around 8-10lbs or so, but today's plastics are pretty rugged. I'm thinking it'll last long enough to be a good investment.

Just got this vacuum in the mail today. Super easy set up and works great! I just vacuumed my living room yesterday with my old vacuum and today with my new one. Look at how much this vacuum picked up that my old one missed! Absolutely impressed by this vacuum! Easy to use, suction is great, cord is long, easy to clean the container after use, very light weight.

This vacuum cleaner works well. I love everything about it. It has great suction and it is light and easy to clean with. The cord could be a bit longer but that is the only thing I would change. Changing from floor cleaning to utility is easy and so is emptying it. Very happy

This vacuum is exactly what I was looking for. It goes from floor to carpet with ease and has great suction. It is light and easy to move around… the long home and attachments make it easy to reach farther than just vacuuming. And they come in handy when cleaning the stairwell

I looked at lots of vacuums and read lots of reviews.  This Eureka PowerSpeed NEU 180 sounded good, with lots of great reviews.  I need something that will take care of pet hair (dog and a cat) and be simple to use and  empty, and not require replaceable filters.A lot of reviewers showed  how much hair the vac got up after using their old vacuum first.  They were not kidding!  I ran the Eureka over a short nap carpet about 15 x 15 feet, and the dust bin was nearly full of hair and dirt.  it had only been a couple of days since I vacuumed with my old Rainbow.  I am amazed!  This thing is light and easy to maneuver, gets under the toe space and under the edges of furniture easily.  It cleans right to the edge.  Unlike any vacuum I ever had before, this is NOT noisy.  I always wore hearing protectors with the old ones, and don't even need them with this  Not loud or obnoxious at all.The ease of dumping the dust bin is a big thing for me.  I hesitated to use the Rainbow because you have to fill it with water, then find a place to dump the water/dirt/hair sludge.  Then rinse and clean the cannister.  My old Filter Queen used paper filters that need to be changed, and it was a nasty dusty mess to empty.  Also very heavy.  Also expensive:  I paid something like $450 for that think way back in 1972!The new Eureka Was $78.  Both the Filter Queen and Rainbow were getting problems, but still worked.  I also have a Dirt Devil I bought years ago and used about twice and hated.  (Want them?  Come and get 'em for FREE.)I can't find anything negative about the Eureka.  I am looking forward to vacuuming the rest of the house and picking up a bushel of pet hair.Some notes on things previous reviewers complained about:Some folks talked about the hole in the end of the handle, and that the hose was too short.  They must not have gotten the instructions with theirs.  The handle doubles as a wand that extends the hose so you can reach furniture, drapes, etc.  The Owner's Use Manual that came with mine is great.  Well Illustrated,  thorough, and easy to understand.  Another plus.Several people said the height adjustment did not work, and it either was too low and burned the carpet, or too high and wouldn't clean.  I checked min before  using it, and the height adjustment wheels were indeed stuck and would not  lower when you turned the knob.  I called Customer Service right away.  Got a person quickly who was very helpful.  While she was taking my information, I kept fiddling with the height rollers, and it started working!  I am not mechanically illiterate, but do not know why it unstuck or what was holding it to begin with.  So, it works fine.  I did find that Customer Service was very responsive.I will update this review if anything changes or problems arise.Maybe it is kind of sad that at this stage in life I get excited about a new vacuum (smile) but it is a real treat to find a great product at a great price that really works!

reviewTitle: This thing SUCKS (literally!! It works so well!)
reviewDescription: Alright, I got this vacuum cleaner today, so I can't speak for the long-term durability of it, I sure hope it holds up, but let me tell you about my experience. I assembled it in maybe 10-15 minutes and I can't follow written instructions for nothing, so it'd probably take a normal person even less time, 5 minutes maybe. I was skeptical given the price point, but I read some reviews and took a chance on this vacuum. I want to start by saying I'm 30 and single, I do -not- fall in love easily y'all, but this vacuum might have been the one to change that. I might love this vacuum more than half the people I've dated, okay? I wanted to test this sucker (no pun intended) against the vacuum I previously had (which is now going in the closet for eternity- it's been replaced, and was also, might I add, more expensive than this one), so I started by vacuuming all the carpeting in my house with my old vacuum. My upstairs is entirely carpeted and I have a few rugs downstairs, so keep that in mind. It ain't like my entire house is carpeted. I ran this son of a gun over it AFTER I vacuumed with my old vacuum and this thing still got a POUND (.45 kg for the whole rest of the planet) of crap out of my carpet. I'm pretty sure this thing pulled up ick that's been in this carpet since 1953. I think I vacuumed up dog hair from 3 owners of this house ago. There's probably dust in there from before I was even born. I have never felt more disgusting and cleaner in my entire life now that I've used this. I can't believe I lived will all that in my carpet for all that time. If you're considering this vacuum, just do it. Totally worth it. Can't beat it for the price. Heck, I'm pretty sure it could outperform even more expensive units if it holds up.

I bought this vacuum because my Dyson’s battery life is very short and my Roomba doesn’t go into the bedrooms. I wanted something corded, that could tackle pet hair (we have a chihuahua, a long haired cat, and two poodles) and lots of dust. We (humans and animals) spend a lot of time outside in the garden and are constantly tracking in dirt, plus we keep the windows open to cool the house so dust gets everywhere. All that to say we own two very expensive vacuums that we use constantly to stay on top of the dust and fur.Now, this was after just ONE PASS in our carpeted master bedroom. I can’t believe all the dust and hair that the Dyson was not picking up! It’s wild!Anywho, setting up the vacuum was very quick and easy! I will say that the hose does seem pretty short but I will not be using that function with this vacuum so that’s not a problem for me. It is lightweight and easy to maneuver. I also love that the canister is easy to remove and empty, as well as the filter being so easy to wash! I highly recommend this vacuum.

reviewTitle: The suction of fine dirt from Carpet
reviewDescription: I vacuum my house 1x a week having 2 pitbulls whom I take to daily walks along river in which they live to swim and of course running in the dirt they collect lots of river grit and dirt.  I was Amazed how much grit and fine dirt this vacuum sucked out of my carpet This pic of the collection from just the living room. OMG . The pet hair attachment is just as Amazing. Once you snap on the pet attachment it starts spinning and it Actually picked up fine hair that Pittbulls shed on furniture. I'm absolutely a fan of this vacuum. I had a cleaning business for 16 years and I know vacuums. This one without hesitation is a Winner. No need to look any further. It's also very light weight to move back and forth  without any effort.  Installion was easy didn't need instructions. Snap on and go 👍

When my trusty Hoover finally gave up the ghost I started looking for a suitable replacement. First I visited the Hoover website hoping to find this model or something close. Wrong! They’re all making the same cheap plastic versions now.Like most things made today they no longer make them to last. They purposely design their offerings to wear out in a couple of years forcing you to buy a new one. Oh well … so it goes.The task of finding one like mine was daunting. I didn’t.😩So the next best thing was to find something close that wasn’t too expensive and had reasonably good reviews on Amazon.This Eureka fit the bill nicely. My price was only $89.00, and as you can see in the pictures, it looks very similar to my old work horse.It functions very much like my Hoover upright but sadly without the automatic cord rewind. No biggie.It is much lighter than the Hoover and it glides around the floor with only a gentle push required. Nice.The operating noise level is comparable to the Hoover. About what you’d expect. Not that horrible.The performance was stellar and it was a pleasure to use without a learning curve coming from my Hoover upright.I also like the way everything easily snapped together upon assembly without any issues, except one.At first I thought there was something wrong with the height adjustment. It was locked in place. But then I discovered it works perfectly once you release the handle from its upright position.So far so good.I also appreciate the foot controls that release the handle and turn on the power. Although plastic, they click in place firmly and seem well designed. Time will tell.I first vacuumed my bedroom which has a low pile carpet. I was amazed at all the dust and debris it captured in just a couple of passes (see photo).For the price this thing rocks. You can spend extra to get a few more bells and whistles but why would you want to? Other models seem to have the same motor and dust collecting systems. This Eureka is all I need and I’m thrilled with my purchase.It’s definitely old man approved. lolHope this helps.If it conks out prematurely I’ll leave the appropriate update.Happy cleaning!

reviewTitle: (Update - 8 months later and brush motor dead) Pretty good for a cheaper ($$) vacuum
reviewDescription: UPDATE:  So, I want to preface with, this was still a decent vacuum for the price and although I expected it last a bit longer than 8 months, it still was not a bad overall vacuum for someone on a budget.*** HOWEVER:  the motor that spins the brush in the vacuum head (part that is over the carpet when vacuuming) has stopped working.  I was using one of the handheld attachments one day and suddenly noticed what smelled like small electric motor burning (I think we all know that cliche smell lol).  And looked over at the vacuum and the actual brush motor was smoking.  I immediately unplugged the vacuum, no fire or anything like that.  I let the vacuum sit overnight.  Plugged her back in and turned it on, vacuum still “works,” but the motor for the brush head died, so I can only use the handheld attachments now.*** Be aware, if you are using handheld attachments, the brush head in the actual like vacuum is still spinning. So, what looks like happened to me is that it was spinning and sat idle in one spot too long, started pulling up some of the fiber from the carpet which cause strain on the brush and motor, ultimately causing it to burn out.  I hope that makes sense. *** Again, not a bad vacuum, just be aware of some of the little caveats.  Previous, bit more “high end” vacuums I have owned, the brush in “vacuum head” (part that pushes over the carpet as you vacuum) would still spinning if you were using the handheld attachments.(Original review) I was skeptical buying a cheaper dollar amount vacuum, but this one is definitely worth it.  I downsized to a smaller apartment with only half carpet, didn’t need anything super expensive but wanted to get the job done.  This vacuum definitely accomplishes that goal.  Lightweight.  Good auction.  Decent onboard tools, long cord.Overall, if you’re looking at this vacuum because of the price point, definitely worth it 👍🏽

Unfortunately I  had to return it.  The product description on line was "ultra light".  It was not.  Too heavy to use due to my multiple medical issues relating to my back structure.  I tried but it was to heavy.  It was a beautiful machine overall but just not for me.

Eureka is a long standing name for quality but in this case it failed me in this category.On the outside it's a beautiful lightweight vacuum with all the attachments on board,Then you turn it on and it's ear piercing.  Never had a vacuum as loud as this.  I do not recommendthis product.

This vacuum seems to just create dust clouds. The front vent blows debris around before you even get a chance to vacuum it up. I have asthma and allergies, and the two times I've used this it has blown around the dust causing me to have a reaction. You can see the dust blown out by the vent in the photo.I only used this on hardwood and tile, so I can't speak to how it works on carpet.I don't recommend this product for those with respiratory issues and/or with hardwood or tile.

reviewTitle: Decent basic vacuum but has a major problem
reviewDescription: After months of having this vac, I've had to take it apart with a screwdriver at least 8 times to put the rubber band back in its place. It slips so ferquently that I don't even want to use this vacuum out of fear that I am going to have to take it apart and fix it again. I had to buy new bands the first month bc the initial one broke. This is not a vacuum I would ever recommend to anyone. Will be purchasing a different brand in the near future.

The attachments suck no pun intended!!The entire vacuum falls over every time you use attachments. Its hit me in head several times and nearly broken a glass end table.  The hose is way too short and because it attaches at the middle of the vacuum not at the base it cause vacuum to rotate and fall.  This is a terrible design flaw and safety issue.The hose also does not have the typical hose extenders that allow you to reach further away.  Between the short hose and no extension it only allows you to use attachments within a foot of vaccum. Then because the main vaccum doesnt turn off when you use attachments it blows lots of air around and all the dust and dirt you are trying to reach winds up in your eyes and face not the vaccum.The pet hair attachment works okay but because hose is so short you cant actually use it for entire sofa....It works pretty good if you are using it to do floors up right and canister empties and reattaches easily.I had a similar eureka vaccum for last 13 years I loved. I wish I would have kept that one and replaced belts. I thought I was upgrading.I was unable to retun because I didnt keep the box so keep your box!!Epic regret buying this one!!

The suction is weak, doesn’t pick up dog hair. The vacuum broke after 10months and I was not permitted by customer support to use my 1yr warranty because they claimed it was “out of warranty according to the calculations.” I will not purchase anything from Eureka again.

Had this vacuum a few months and really wanted to try and like it as it’s light weight and promises great features.  The problem is that it. Just doesn’t deliver.  Shorter cord than we prefer, minimal attachments that are not simple to use, seems to spread dust and the wheels or undercarriage have scratched our hardwood.  Not our cup of tea.  Gonna have to go back to a Dyson or shark product.  Really wanted to try and like this and kept trying to convince her that it was a user issue but she was was right - it’s just not a great vacuum — at least for what we need and how we use one.

Works okay, not great by any means, but okay. The belt slips off regularly, the extensions are not very good, the cord it a little too short, and the agitator doesn't bite in very well. I would NOT buy this again.

I didn't even try vacuuming with this machine once I put it together. Put it together in spite of the poorly written instructions, , I should mention. I used to teach college tech writing. I know poorly written instructions. This one gets a red pen. No, the reason I'm returning isn't because of the instructions, although the company is too cheap to hire a professional tech writer, they also seem to be too cheap to hire a designer who actually uses a vacuum cleaner. Maybe I'm just too accustomed to my Dyson, but I'm not going to have anything to do with this short, inconvenient hose. People say size matters, let's be specific: length matters. This hose has nothing to extend it to the appropriate reach for cleaning anything lower than my knees. That little crevice tool? Ha! A few inches won't reach the floor, the baseboards, the tops of the windows where the spiders like to spin their webs, behind the dresser, under the bed .... It's a hose that's about four feet long. In order to use it, you have to bend over and disconnect it from the bottom of the vacuum and either use it as a round hose end or attach one of the three tools. The reason the Amazon listing doesn't show a standing adult using the hose is because an adult has to bend way over to vacuum anything that isn't waist high. When I vacuum, I pull the hose on my Dyson out several times and use it all kinds of places: under the couch, along the kitchen cabinets, around the baseboards, on the stairs. No way this thing can do those jobs unless I crawl on my hands and knees. And I won't get on my hands and knees for a too-short hose. For all I know, it sucks just fine, but I didn't even plug it in once I saw how poorly designed it is. I'm not sure why anybody gave it a 5-star rating, but obviously a lot of people are willing to settle for a short, inconvenient hose. I'm too old for that. I bought this so I'd have a second vacuum when I didn't feel like lugging my Dyson down the stairs. I'd rather lug my Dyson than try to get the job done with this cheap vacuum. Next!

Good suction but the design is horrible. The canister is always getting clogged if you have to vacuum more than tiny pieces of dirt, I.e. pet hair. So I constantly have to remove the top part and pull it all out with my hands instead of just dumping it. Sometimes when I turn it on the filters blow out a giant cloud of dust. Would not recommend.

reviewTitle: THIS IS NOT A GOOD VACUUM TO GET...
reviewDescription: I HAD TO GET REPLACEMENT PARTS AS THE FIRST VACUUM BROKE BEFORE 3 USES. THEN, THE THING WOULD NOT TURN OFF AS THE ON/OFF SWITCH STAYED IN THE ON POSITION, SO HAD TO GET A REPLACEMENT VACUUM AS THAT WAS DANGEROUS.

reviewTitle: Great vacuum but ruined my rug :(
reviewDescription: Has this happened to anyone else? It was my first time using it on this rug in particular and somehow there are white skid marks all over my rugHowever the product itself works great! As well as the attachments

This is an average, cheap vacuum. I'm a stay-at-home-mom and I've used several through the years. Comparing this vacuum to others, the biggest issue I had was not just the noise, but the high-pitched frequency/ringing sound when it was on. I have kids with special needs that cannot tolerate that sound, but neither can I. My ears were ringing after only two minutes of using the vacuum.Also, the hose is seriously too short. I read that in another review, but it's obnoxiously too short. When I used the hose, I was right next to the vacuum and the whole thing fell over on me as soon as I pulled the hose only inches away.I think if you're looking for a cheap vacuum for a small space or dorm, it's ok. It does pull things up as it should. But daily or weekly use is out of the question with the ringing sound and the hose. I returned it right away.Hope this helps!
This Eureka vacuum did not live up to it’s reviews.  Does not have enough suction power to pick up dirt or hair from high pile or low pile carpeting. Cheaply made .

used it a half dozen times, when i noticed when after i disposed of dirt contents from holding cup and placed  it back it emmited  dust into the air. I have tried it several times and did it again at this point I will not be using probably throw it away.
I got this vacuum for my upstairs since it is all carpet. I have to go over certain spots at least three or four times to get something up. Super disappointed.

reviewTitle: My vacuum is missing a piece on the handle
reviewDescription: My vacuum, which is a present, is missing the handle wand—- so the handle has no closure on it, with a notch on the side, which is obviously for something to snap in there, I would appreciate it being shipped to me ASAP, thank you

I needed a new vacuum and I bought this one. It is all plastic and when using it the hose does tend to come out from the vacuum and the dust goes everywhere.Have to watch that.I've had it about a month and now it won't pick up. I used it yesterday and it did not clean at all. I have to call customer service tomorrow...No, I don't think I would recommend this vacuum.

reviewTitle: I really wanted to like it....but
reviewDescription: Okay, I don't feel like you're supposed to feel like you just did a full body workout after 10 minutes of using a vacuum??? It does not glide well on carpet and I have normal low carpet. This is the second vacuum this week I have tried from this Eureka brand and both were a bust. The suction on this one seemed great at first, then a few minutes into using it I noticed it wasn't picking much up. I checked the bottom to see if maybe I forgot to remove something when assembling, but nope! I might have just gotten a bad vacuum? Not sure. I can't even get in touch with customer service which is even more annoying. I really wanted my vacuum search to be over, but guess not.
The machine was a bit noisy when its running

reviewTitle: Great vacuum for the price especially
reviewDescription: It's a little cumbersome and doesn't get under small spaces but the hose and things makes up for that. Good price and has great suction.
Easy to assemble and use, so far. Seems to be well made. Have not used Attachments yet
Seem to work very well rent in Sr Apt so carpet our not new but to made them look a lot better

I had vacuumed the day before when the vacuum died. I bought this one and was surprised. I went over the same place where I had cleaned the day before with my old vacuum. I was pleasantly surprised how much stuff the new vacuum pulled out of the carpet! Love it!
Vacuum has very good suction. Been using rechargeable vacuum. Than went back too a real vacuum couldn’t believe the difference. Good price.
Have small area to vacuum and works great
Love it! It’s perfect and a great value.
Works extremely well. Strong suction and great accessories

...good! It is brand new. Here's what I know so far:It's very light in weight (which I greatly appreciate)It has great vacuuming power (the dander and cat fur it picked up is crazy!!)I don't love that I have to switch the main hose position to use the handheld feature, but other than that, I like it very much.I'll give an update review in a few weeks.
This vacuum is great on any surface and will pick up dirt fast
can't say anything first hand, but my son and his wife love it
I like that it picks up dirt so well and easy to clean.
I meeded something simple with a strong suction.  Better than expected.

I am a mom of 4 boys. So sports and dirt is easy in this home. It seemed small and I underestimated its power. Not loud and pick up dust and all. I would definitely buy again. Had Hoover and it started to smoke. So happy with this vacuum.
HAVE NOT USED PRODUCT YET !  PURCHASED AS A BACKUP !!
It's not bad for the price. It does a good job cleaning I must say. Its a bit heavy for me . Other than that it's a good deal.
Needed a all around good vacuum at a reasonable price.  This one really fit my needs completely.  I would recommend to anyone!  Thanks.
This works good  light weightBagless emptying is a breeze

After both our Hoover corded vacuum and our Dyson stick vacuum bit the dust within two months, I desperately needed a new vacuum but didn’t want to pay hundreds. I landed on this one after reading lots of good reviews and it arrived today. It was super easy to put together and HOLY MOLY, the amount of stuff it sucked up was…disgusting! Our house was vacuumed less than a week ago and I was horrified by how much this vacuum picked up! Tells me just how badly we needed a new one!It’s only been a few hours, but I’m very pleased with this vacuum and the value for the cost!

Well, I was really excited about the looks of this vacuum when I first looked at the product details and other reviews on here.I’d never loved a vacuum more than the Dyson Ball I had back in 2016. This appeared to be a pretty good “knock-off” version of the Ball so I bought it!Pros: Lightweight, easily transforms from beater bar to handheld hose, several attachments, bag-less.Cons: Falls often when vacuuming with hose, does not work too well on hardwood floors even when on hardwood floor setting, (Debris often get flung around and not sucked up), area around filter gets clogged quickly (especially with pet hair-need to open and pull hair off filter area), when emptying canister need to pull apart filter casings to get a try everything emptied- not just an open and dump typically.In short, works well on carpet but be prepared to empty and unclog often. If you have a lot of hardwood floors or LVT, this vacuum should probably be a pass.

I refuse to buy expensive vacuums because the ones I've had have broke after a few years so I decided to try this one out.  I'm a big fan overall.  It's light nah easy to use.  The attachments are conveniently stored and don't get in the way.  There are 2 buts....1). You can't vacuum up large even light things. Think pieces of torn paper or a puff of cotton.  They will get stuck in the hose and it's kinda a pain to disassemble and clean out.  2) I've only had it a few months and the belt for the brush has broken twice.  It's very easy to replace and easy to find the replacements.  But overall I'm happy with the strength of the vacuum

reviewTitle: Be aware that the rolling brush cannot be stopped!
reviewDescription: The construction of the cleaner is very cheaply made. I used to have a very similar model from the same brand and it was robust, and the filters abundant and reusable, and that is no longer the case. The main issue and why we had to return it is that you cannot stop the brush on the cleaner when using on  for rugs that have very long threads. The threads of our rug got immediately caught and cut on the vacuum cleaner, so it is definitely a problem when the roll cannot be a stopped. A previous model had the option to stop the brush as needed, but this one doesn’t, so it didn’t work for us. Other than that, the sucking power seemed OK.

I'll give this thing the benefit of the doubt and say that it may be my carpet that's the problem. It's old and worn and has the carpet equivalent of loose threads, so the vacuum always has something stuck in it. I feel like a better vacuum would just easily suck it in without anything getting caught in the roller. Not only that, a lot of debris somehow dispenses itself out of it. Maybe I'm vacuuming wrong, maybe I just have it on the wrong setting; I didn't think the procedure of vacuuming was rocket science.With that being said, it mostly does the job. It's not a terrible vacuum, I guess I just expected a little more. It's also easy for the attachments to fall off of their holders so that's annoying. Anyway, get this vacuum if none of the things I mentioned is a big deal to you!

reviewTitle: Disappointing - Light Weight Light Duty Only
reviewDescription: Purchased this to replace a shark unit we had for years and the handle broke.While this get's good reviews, it's no nearly as powerful and robust as the Shark.  My wife wanted the hand tools to clean couch cushions, but the brush can't tolerate and pressure and it stops easily (pretty useless).  the power is pretty light and it has not filtering which we had on the shark.  The shark also has much more propelling power when in use.I would have returned it, but we got outside the return window.I repaired the old Shark and keep using it as the Eureka is disappointing at best.  These are comparative statements based on a vacuum I really like and Eureka doesn't come close to.

reviewTitle: Great suction but not worth it
reviewDescription: Update after using for few weeks:: the cord will be the death of you - if you have a huge distance to vacuum get something with a WAY longer cord. It is placed low so it gets stuck and you keep running over it. Also it doesn’t swivel so I can only seem to vacuum my rugs in one direction or I literally can’t seem to push the vacuum in the opposite direction on the rug, which is annoying. Good news- was missing a piece so it does have a location for the cord to wrap. Overall I’d spend a little more and get a shark or other vacuum.I only received this vacuum yesterday and used it for the first time. I’ll update here as time goes on. I had an Oreck vacuum for 14 years. It was a powerhouse, and if that’s what you’re going from you may be somewhat disappointed. This Eureka vacuum doesn’t have the swivel head, there is no place to roll up the cord and the place it somewhere , the cord is extremely short (that has been mentioned in many reviews) so if you don’t have many outlets this isn’t a vacuum for you, also the hose that you can detach to clean is very short so you’ll have to lift high above you if you’re looking to work on curtains, blinds, skylights, etc. The pros are that it has great suction & there is no bag needed. It’s exceptional suction for this price. I have a ton of plants and it’s useful as in it blows the air up and sucks the stuff up, so if you have loose leaves it will get them off the plant and suction- you won’t have to repeat the vacuuming once you’re done in that area. I have lots of kids and a dog so was excited to try something without bags. I’ll keep you posted with how this holds up. Another few reviews said this vacuum is quiet- I have mostly hardwood floors and highly disagree. It is an average loud, but definitely nothing quiet about it. Must know: no place to food up cord, cord is located low so if you don’t wrap it between the handle you will keep vacuuming over it and it drives you insane, need many outlets because cord is short - amazing suction on a budget, no bags required, easy assembly and operation.

If you live in an area that's very dusty, like you clean and within a day there's already enough dust that it's noticeable and by the end of the week it looks like you haven't cleaned in a month, you'll probably want to go with a bagged vacuum unless you've got some tricks.I went to empty out the container for the first time and nearly died at all the dust and the fine particle dirt cloud that filled the air. In retrospect, this much should have been obvious. In addition, the top of the tank is still filled with all the dust particles that wouldn't come out even after emptying it.Still, I'm apparently too lazy to return this so I guess I'll have to figure something out. It's certainly better than the old vacuum we were using. Powerful suction, great attachments, the cat tree finally looks clean and the carpet just feels and looks cleaner than it has since we shampooed it.People complain about it being light but the whole point was for it to be light to make it easier to carry around and up stairs and whatnot, it's literally in the description. It works exactly as described.And despite the amazingly strong suction that got even the deep rooted hairs out of the cat tree and practically sucked the fine dust off the floor underneath the carpet, I don't have a problem with the suction of the hose knocking the vacuum around like many others complained of. Then again, maybe I just know how use vacuums so as to not run into such issues. Lord knows I used to have that issue even with the heaviest of older vacuums when I was younger so I learned how to position the vacuum so that it didn't happen and now I don't have the problem even with super light vacuums. You CAN work around this, you CAN'T have the best of both worlds. Well, maybe someday we'll be able to click a rotator selection wheel to adjust the weight of an object, make it super light to carry around or super heavy to ensure it sits in one place, but that day is not yet upon us.Addressing other concerns I noted in the reviews: could the hose be longer and less stiff? Sure. Will it grow to be less stiff over time? Almost assuredly.

UPDATE:  I am returning  this vacuum.  Not only am I not happy with the blowing of items, and the loudness.  The cord is not long enough, I can't reach anything with the handle, and cleaning it out is a nightmare.  I used it twice, and am returning it.This vacuum is very loud, the handle isn't very long, I'm short with high ceilings, so I can reach the corners.  I bought it for upstairs use (as I'm getting older and carrying mine up and down has become a nuisance).  If I had bought it for my main vacuum, I'd be returning it.  That being said, I didn't notice any issues with it picking up anything off the floor, even got the cat litter.

What I like about this vacuum cleaner is that it is lightweight, it was easy to put together, the dirt collector is very easy to remove from the vacuum cleaner to empty. The suction is also really great. What I don’t like about it is that the hose is very short and there is no extension  tool. It also is very noisy, noisier than other vacuum cleaners I’m used to. In general, I’m happy with the vacuum cleaner

reviewTitle: Not as powerful as I hoped- need a floor model
reviewDescription: Stick vacuum cleaners are a wonderful thought but not very effective even for my apartment where I live alone and have no pet and few visitors. I mainly walk barefooted inside but my helper wears shoes that are clean. She has dogs. My stick vacuums have not been satisfactory x 3 different ones. Get a light floor model.

reviewTitle: Overall Great Vacuum, Great Suction and Excellent for Pet Hair
reviewDescription: Got this vacuum and tried it out on a 10X11 foot room.  I had been using a Bissell prior which basically started to malfunction (damaged motor bearings) after only 9 months.  Set up this Eureka (very easy) and on the first vacuum the dirt container was FULL.  It picked up that much hair the Bissell had left behind!! The suction is strong and will easily swallow a curtain if it gets caught in it.  It vacuumed up cat hair easily and thoroughly.  It is sturdy and a great vacuum especially for the price.  The filter is washable.  The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because 1) the hose should be longer however that is an issue with all vacuums.  This one is what you would expect and works fine, but with stairs you need a LONG hose.  A hose extension should be an attachment for stairs.  2) I wish it would go flatter to move it all the way under the bed.  It outperforms Bissell no question and a comparable Hoover I purchased before that.  Its a keeper and I am now relieved to actually have the built up hair and dirt suctioned up! Summary good overall, very good suction, great at getting up pet hair and a sturdy vacuum well worth the money.  Outperforms other comparable vacuums of other brands.

Really great suction, it got a lot of pet hair out of my carpet even after I had just run over it with my old vacuum. The pet upholstery tool works well but when there’s suction the little brush stops spinning so I feel like it could be doing better. The hose is technically long but doesn’t stretch out easily so you usually end up tipping the base over. The canister is very large and holds a lot of dust but when you empty it it gets all over the outside and makes the vacuum always dirty. There is a puff of air that shoots out the top of the vacuum while you’re running it that blows papers off of coffee tables, which is a little annoying.

reviewTitle: Nearly returned it, glad I didn't.
reviewDescription: So let me start off with saying when I received this it was used (had hair and whatnot in the bottom part) so I automatically was going to return it because I didn't pay for a used vacuum cleaner and felt like if someone had returned it there was a reason. So I accidentally missed the return date so I was like well, whatever if I'm going to keep it I might as well use it. Our other vacuum cleaner has been messed up for a couple weeks and I kept putting it off getting a new one. We have an Australian Shepherd which shed like crazy and I needed a specific vacuum to pick up his fur, well this is it! This was one real quick sweep over an area rug. I also love how light it is! Only complaint was I wish it had a retractable cord, I probably wouldn't have purchased it had I realized it didn't. Still glad I did though!

I bought this little Eureka vacuum because I was tired of carrying my Kirby down the stairs hence I haven't swept as much as i should. And I have allergies and CATS.So, this vacuum was easy to put together right out of the box. I consulted the assembly instructions on the first page of the manual but didn't really need that because it was pretty self explanatory. It was all assembled and ready to roll in about five minutes.I was impressed by the amount of grime that came up right away. There is a setting for low pile carpet , a setting for high pile carpet and a setting for bare floor.I used both the bare floor setting and the low pile carpet for my area.The one drawback I found is the cord is only twenty five feet long. My room is not even that big but I found I had to change to another outlet to finish the other side of the room.The outside of the unit is equipped with mostly hard plastic pieces for power button and handle release, so time will tell if those will hold out.It had been about two weeks since I had vacuumed downstairs previously. The amount of dust, cat hair, and filth that I got up was amazing. It pretty much filled half of the canister. Maybe more. Unfortunately some of that stuck up in the top of the canister and it empties from the bottom so I had to stick my hand up there to get it the rest of it out.The unit is lightweight and easy to push.It blew hot air from the unit and that was powerful enough to knock some papers off of my desk three feet away. So that is a little annoying because I know it's blowing dirt all over as well. Luckily it picks up dirt really well also! I think this eureka model is going to be exactly what I intended it to be and save my poor back!I used the crevice tool attachment to get in behind my desk. Unfortunately the hose is a little short, but I stretched it out and made it work.For the price it's exactly what I needed.Minus one star for cord length and the amount of pressured air it blows out.

Literally! The picture I took is after 1 sweep of my living room. Mind you I vacuumed with my inse just 2 days before I used this and this is what got sucked up. I immediately fell in love. Worth the money and especially if you have a shredding pet get the pet tool!The only issue I have is with the handheld brush. It does often get stuck and stops rotating during vacuuming and I would need to either shake it or manually move the brush so it'll start rotating again.Other than that the main base works so well. It is a little heavy especially when you're doing the stairs but worth it to get all the dirt off. The power is great and assembly took 5 mins. I didn't understand why the handle was hollow until I realized it's also used as an extension for the hose.I just hope this lasts for a long time.

This is really a great vacuum cleaner for the price. the suction is great, it’s not too heavy, all the extra accessories and parts are stored right on the unit itself, the cord is long and it’s easy to empty and clean out. The ONLY problem I’m having so far is the detachable handle part is a bit short. I’m only 5’4” but when I use that attachment I feel like I have to still bend down quite a bit to reach everything. Still a great purchase and probably my favorite vacuum cleaner I’ve owned, but I will be seeing if there’s an extension piece available

reviewTitle: Does the job, but nothing great
reviewDescription: I purchased this Eureka vacuum to replace a 6 year old $50 Bissell Power Force Helix, which had a burnt out motor (after using roughly 5 minutes per week while keeping filter clean and canister empty). So I wanted to try a different brand. Honestly, the only improvement over the Bissell are the extra attachments with longer wand. It cleans carpets well, and solid floors okay. The suction is about the same, the noise is about the same and the cord is about the same length as the cheaper Bissell. Hopefully this one lasts a bit longer. My guess is, you need to step up to a $200+ model to get better performance. Bottom line, the final star rating will depend on the longevity. This one is fine if you have a small home, but don't expect anything amazing.

Perfect for my apartment. Feels well made for the price. Good suction. Huge debris container. Great selection of fittings.BUT I REALLY wish it came with the tube extension that most vacuums come with. I wasn't paying attention and just assumed it did.  I really need the tube extension to reach my tall ceilings. Had to order one separately. Only reason I deducted a star. Otherwise great vacuum.

It's a good vacuum cleaner. But it's not really what I wanted. It's heavy. It's not lightweight at all. I was looking for a powerful, lightweight but I guess I can't find it. I liked the smaller green one better, but that one doesn't have enough suction.

I like the machine, it works well.  Its fairly quiet. What I am having a bit of a hard time with is that it doesn't have another length of extension and I have to bend over quite a bit (its easier just to get on the floor) while trying to vac where the floor meets the wall. I can take the handle out and attach it to the hose and crevice tool but the hose while being sturdy, doesn't stretch to far without tipping over the machine. I am trying to see if there is another piece available. I had a eureka that quit but before I threw it away I checked to see if the extension pieces would fit - of course they don't.

I purchased this to have a backup vacuum for our basement, I have used it 4 times for light pickup as we are rarely downstairs! This evening I went to use it and it sounded like it was going to blow up! The squealing was awful! I turned it off asap, looked for issues something caught in the roller,.. no, something thing in the hose.. no. Turned dials to see if the noise changed.. no.. unplugged, restarted, Same noise! Checked the belt and it was fine. I emptied the  canister it was barely full.. still the same noise. Unable to return as I bought the beginning of the year. Super disappointed in this vacuum!

I purchased this vacuum because it was higher than average ratings and because it was for people with pets. I have 2 dogs that shed constantly and this vacuum couldn't do the job. After the first 3 times of use it stopped it's suction. Hoses were stuffed with fur. Made sure all hoses and filter was cleaned out. Then it happened even more frequently. After 3 weeks there was little to no suction even after clogged hoses. Took apart vacuum and found fur in the motor. Could have actually caused a fire. I've owned other Eurekas that worked fine but they stopped selling those models and ended up buying this one. Not pleased.

reviewTitle: Might have been a good machine, except for a high-pitched squeal.
reviewDescription: I needed a new vacuum, and it seemed like this would meet my needs. But above the sound of the motor, there was a high-pitched squeal. I decided I couldn't put up with it, so I returned it.

reviewTitle: Easy to put together but already partly broke :(
reviewDescription: good, cute vacuum for the price. Very manageable. However, after the 5th time I used it the rolling part of the bottom of the vacuum just stopped working (doesn't pick up anything). Only the hose works.  Unfortunately, I will need to purchase another one :(. So disappointing.
Powerful vacuum, however the exhaust blows dirt and hair away from the path of the vacuum before it can be sucked up. Poor design flaw. Makes it very difficult to pick up hair on a hardwood floor.

reviewTitle: Decent suction, design could be better
reviewDescription: The good:Vac has decent suction, is lightweight and affordable.The bad:Cord is too short and needs to be attached up near handle. Where cord is attached now you have to hold it up off the floor with other hand to keep out of way while in use. Crevice tool is too short and needs to be a little narrower. Pet turbo brush tool is useless. It bogs down and quits spinning as soon as you touch the fabric of a couch or dog bed. Suction hose is attached too high on canister which causes the vac to tip over easily when using handle attachments. Speaking of handle, it also is too short when using tools for floor level dust bunnies.I would not recommend this vacuum for people that are tall-ish, have pets or, large rooms to vacuum.

reviewTitle: I guess you get what you pay for
reviewDescription: Just replaced it w an Oreck. A reasonable and inexpensive vacuum; it does its job decently, but cleaning it well is a lot of work, including screwdriver, and you have to clean it frequently. The hose is quite stiff so be careful on stairs you don't get smacked in the head by the upright as you extend the hose. Believe me. For pet households, it does a pretty good job getting the hair, but you still should use one of those carpet rakes and then vacuum...which sort of makes you go, why am I doing two things? Plus the vacuum reeks if you have pets.

So far I’ve had this vacuum a few months, I bought it in anticipation of getting a golden retriever puppy.  That day finally came and when it came time to vacuum the house of dog hair, I was met with the most idiotic product design for a vacuum marketed towards pet owners.The exhaust is right at the bottom of the front of the vacuum.  Meaning the air blows directly on the floor in front of the vacuum, sending hair not only up in the air but also 4ft in front, making it impossible to actually get most hair in the unit.Im giving this two stars because the couch attachment works great, and the vacuum itself has good suction when trying to clean anything but pet hair.

reviewTitle: Not the best..only because the short cords n hose
reviewDescription: This deception is really great on this vacuum boy didn't pick up a lot of dirt but I was really disappointed on the length of the court itself and the length of the accord to the attachments I can barely use the attachments because the cord is so short the hose so that's disappointing because that's half of the reason I bought this vacuum so if they do a redesign I really hope they consider putting longer cords and hoses so we can actually use the vacuum properly thanks a happy housewife

reviewTitle: Great Product but Eureka support SUCKS!
reviewDescription: Works great! When I was setting it up,I noticed the latch on the dust cup didn't "click"shut when closing the lid. Product manual states it should "click" to secure the lid. The bottom lid needs to be manually put into locked position. Contacted Eureka support. They asked for pictures and verification of purchase,which was provided. After 7 calls in two days, they called back and requested I send more proof the item is defective.I will be ordering my own dust cup to replace it. Really frustrated with that company!
Purchased this vacuum to clean carpeted area and large rug in a showroom. Suction works great, it was super easy to assemble and easy to clean.

I’ve had just about every vacuum possibly imaginable and they all end up crapping out on me. I decided to go back to basics and just purchased this vacuum as I had one many moons ago and I never had any issues. Good deal and it works great for a household with pets and children. No complaints.
The vacuum is light weight, has attachments. It does the job. I don't like that the carpet brush never stop, even when set on bare floor. It shoots sand around.  But for the price...
it's decent no complaints.
All is pretty good, I just do not really like much the fact that I have to fold the cable myself. Other than that, the vacuum is really good!

Update: It is growing on me, does good work.  Assembly Manual was bad. 2 pieces were not in the manual. Found a small insert for the items in a zip bag.  Not very descriptive instructions.  One picture is even reversed of actual unit.  Not confident of sturdiness.  I assemble lots of things and this one that should have been so simple was frustrating.  By the way...do I leave the plastic 2 pcs that hold together the filters?  Not mentioned.  I assume I should snip them off like you do new socks?  or maybe doesn't matter?  Too heavy to carry up/down stairs, so I have one vac per level in house.  Just mentioning.

This is a great vacuum cleaner and it does a great job. The only thing I would like better is if the hose were longer. It’s difficult to reach under my furniture and I end up knocking the vacuum cleaner over trying to reach under things.

botten as a unit with beauty defects (which I couldn't find), its perfect for my light  duty  inmy basement---and at a price underBought as a unit with beauty defects (which I couldn't find), it works well for  my basement use---and for less than $60!  Happy with the results!
Lightweight and does a great job.

I recently purchased a cordless vacuum which works well; however, I missed having a hose attachment for vacuuming the stairs and hard to reach areas.  I looked at several vacuums and their reviews, deciding on this one.  A good decision!  It does really well on both carpets and hardwood floors and the suction, which is my #1 priority, is great.  The only issue is with the dust cup.  It has a button to press and release the cover on the bottom to empty the contents.  However, there is no way to empty contents stuck at the top of the dust cup and now it's stuck there.  Typically, there are buttons at the top and bottom.  There is no way to get to the top to get the content out since the filter is at the top and when you remove it, the plastic cover is screwed down.  Overall, I like the vacuum and it does the job well.  I just wish that I could empty all of the contents!

Ii love this vacuum cleaner!  I have an older upright vacuum that was much more expensive than this, but it was becoming too heavy to lug up & down stairs.  This lightweight Eureka is so much easier to use & has much more power than I expected. It comes with all the attachments & an easy container to open & dump the debris ~ no bags to buy ~yay!  I great product that I would definitely purchase again!

I don’t normally write reviews but I felt like I needed to on this one! This was the first use after vacuuming two days before with the old vacuum! I am amazed at how much was left behind! 🙌 Go buy now!

I recently purchased laminate floors for my home. Beautiful but now I had to use 1 vacuum for floors and another for rugs. This solved my problem. High quality, easy to use, good size and very lightweight. It has not clogged so far and the attachments are easy to use. When I vacuum the house now, I only have to turn the switch to choose bare floor or rug. Made my life easier. Highly recommend.

My vacuum came in yesterday. So I vacuumed three of six rooms and pulled up a load of dirt and pet fur which tells me my old vacuum had not been doing anything but surface cleans. After I cleaned all rooms I went through the entire house again, this time using specific flooring settings, and this buy here kept on removing the dirt. So far I love it! Just hope that the life span on this vacuum is as good as the job it does, but we will see.
I love this vacuum!  I can’t believe it is under $100.  We’ll see how long it lasts.  But it is not too heavy, it has great suction and pulls so much out of our carpet!

I really like this vacuum it was a perfect size. The cord size was long. I was very stable. It wasn’t too too loud. I wish I was able to take a picture of it but my husband by accident threw away my vacuum. I really did like this product maybe someday I will purchase this one again.

I absolutely LOVE this vacuum!!!  I havent had a new vacuum in quite some time but needed to get one so I opted in for Eureka.  This thing is AMAZING!  The amount of debris it picks up, even after I've swept or think an area is clean, is crazy!In my video review, I show how much it picked up from my carpet, which was clean...I highly recommend at least giving it a shot.  Its super simply to put together and just does such a great job!

my dyson never picked up dog hairs and i used to vacuume over the same spot on carpets multiple times to pick up the hairs. my dyson recently stopped working on carpet so i needed a new vaccum which killed me bc my dyson was 650$. i bought this vacuum and its literally a dream. it works excellent. i hate that it has a cord but it is so worth it. works better than my dyson ever did. i’m obsessed.

Its so light but powerful. Easy to clean. The amount of dirt that came out of my carpet I was amazed that thing sucked all that up. Gross! But I'm happy i'm not breathing it in at least. Great product and very lightweight. Easy to carry up and down the stairs.

The quality of this vacuum is amazing. Perfect size for home or apartment. Easy to setup. The vacuum is super portable and the cord is long enough to vacuum multiple rooms. Highly recommend. It has spots on the vacuum for all the accessories and can clean bare floors to shag rugs.

reviewTitle: I bought this March 16-2024 ,  and already the carpet height  switch does not work.
reviewDescription: I used this to vacumn the living room carpet.  I can't use it now at all.  suctions down so hard it won"t push on the carpet.
It is very heavy and missing parts. Just ok on suction.

reviewTitle: Not ideal for pet hair on hard surfaces.
reviewDescription: Update: The hose is ridiculously short, every time I used it regardless of how far I am pulling it the vacuum ends up falling over and hitting me in the head.So first, I want to acknowledge that the price for the vacuum is great for what you get, no doubt about that. However, when I use it to vacuum up hair on hardwood surface I noticed that the vent is on the front so it just blows the hair away from me and all over the room (into my sink and all over the furniture) making the job much harder. That being said the suction power is decent for the vacuum and it functions well enough for most people. I ordered it as a temporary fix until my Dyson V15 gets here, which I would recommend to anyone with pets, get the Dyson V15 for the extra money, it is very worth it.
It pulls a lot of dust dirt and hair but it is so hard to push around even  on the highest setting.

pros:Suction.Cons:HeavyLoud 98 -102 dBA.Useless on hardwood floors.Hose is very short.This vac has good suction but for us, we have hardwood floors, the vac seems poorly designed for that purpose.The vac has its exhaust facing forward in the front of the vac and close to the ground.  Due to this design the exhaust blows some of the dust and dirt away from the vac before you reach the area you are going to vacuum. This vacuum only has one level of suction and its set to very high this unit is extremely loud, 98 -102 dBA loud. The hose on the unit is very short, if you think you are going to vacuum tops of your blinds or high up areas the hose is to short and its elastic nature of the hose is very tight so it will snap back very quickly... due to the hose shortness, its elasticity and weight of the vac it makes cleaning anything high up a pain in the butt to do ... the hose attachment seems to be an afterthought.

Received this before Christmas 2023 and it worked great! Fast forward 3 months and it started to both suck up and spit out what it was vacuuming. Thought it may have needed a new belt, but the belt was fine. Cleaned it out and made sure no blockages and it still continues to suck up and spit out dust and dirt. Disappointed.

I constantly get ZAPPED every time I use this vacuum and have to stop halfway because it builds up so much that it becomes painful. The worst part is all the dust and dirt that clings to the OUTSIDE of the vacuum because of all the static. I have never had this problem with a vacuum before.
Poorly designed, attachements are awkward to use, cord is too short, it’s very loud and clunky. I can’t wait until it breaks so I can get something else, I’m guessing I won’t have to wait long.

Its a cheap price for sure but just doesn't work after only 30 days of use.  Went to return it but was one day late.  Usually saying something doesn't suck is good, but a vacuum cleaner...well I wish this one worked. I wish I would have gone for one of the other brands ;(
Lasted 3 months. Sweeper bar is no longer working.  Very low quality, overall.  Eureka help desk is slow to engage. Over three days, they are still debating the format of my proof of purchase.

The hose is definitely not long enough to comfortably use the accessories..you have to bend over excessive or kneel to floor while using accessories. The unit is lightweight which is nice, has good overall workable suction. The canister is easy to empty.
I don't like the fact that the cord does not coil itself inside the machine. It is light weight in general and I can't see how it can last for a long time if use every day. No more Eureka for me.

If you want to use the wand, you have to disconnect the hose from the vacuum and connect it to the wand.  And then the reverse to vacuum normally again.  Mine did not come with the flexible extendable crevice tool as advertised.  The power cord is too short.  Have to unplug and replug to get to all my areas.  So far, the suction is good though.

I guess it just don't understand the way it was designed. You basically have to take it apart if you want to use the hand tool and then you have to take it apart to use the vacuum. Meaning you have to disconnect the hose to connect one or the other. Unlike most vacuum cleaners.I bought the pet version because I have three dogs and they shed well. When your vacuuming the exhaust comes out the front. So as you're vacuuming up the hair, it's blowing the hair away from the vacuum up into the air so that doesn't make sense to me either.As far as the canister that catches the hair and the dirt, it doesn't make sense because there's a mini container at the top of a canister. So as the hair comes in it feels that little cup blocks the opening so nothing else can come in. And basically you still have 90% of the canister empty but you're emptying it because the top part is blockedI just don't think this was meant for animals
Attachments w/ hose are terrible.The vacuum suction is excellent, the unit is a little bulky. 6 out of 10 in my opinion
Still doesn't do the greatest job with pet hair on my couch. The " pet hair attachment " just stalls out immediately upon touching fabric.

The box was taped with postal tape, ,items loose in box, and vacuum started when plugged in, not turning it on. I will watch it for a few weeks, it’s very loud and I am not sure that is a normal sound. Maybe why it was returned.  As for the vacuum, lots of power. The vacuum was not expensive, so I will hang onto it if it continues to work well,
It leaves brush streaks on my carpet, (bristles spaced too far apart). It has no light.
Me incomoda tener que cambiar el pico para aspirar rincones. Es muy de plastico. Aspira bien.

I purchased this product, in part, because I have a large hairy dog. The pet attachment is useless. Any pressure whatsoever and the brush doesn't spin. In any event it doesn't work well. The attachment hose is short and  stretching it even  a bit causes the vacuum to fall over.  I guess it's OK for a basic, cheap vacuum.

I have area rugs and hard floors in my home and it has been a struggle to find one vacuum that can handle it all. This is the third one I’ve tried and it’s the one I’m most happy with. It can be a struggle on area rugs as it’s very hard to push, but it’s better than the other vacuums I tried. It gets up a tremendous about of stuff - especially the first time I used it. It’s not perfect, but it’s definitely above average..
You can’t beat this for $80 it did a great job. 4 starts because it did squeak some moving it back n forth but no biggie.  The pet and upholstery accessories are wonderful

reviewTitle: Good vacuum but bad for back!
reviewDescription: Like the vacuum very much; has option for either floor or carpet.  Only drawback is the long cord that must be wrapped around the machine which entails body movement of up and down, up & down, up& down etc., etc., etc!  Not good for a bad back!
I wish the canister was a little bigger but overall the vacuum itself works great and the power is strong!
Straight out of the box the roller or wheels squeaks with every pass
For the price it would be tough to beat! It has great suction even with the tools that come with it... It's not to heavy & easy to clean. I'd recommend it to everyone!
It was easy to put together and set up. Was able to do half a two bedroom apartment with a big shedding dog, on one load. Easy to dump container.

This sucks up dog hair from wood floors wonderfully. I wish the hand tool had a longer reach on it, but it still does a good job. Empties easily, and is easy to clean the canister.I like it enough that I bought one for my son who also has a big dog that sheds a lot.

reviewTitle: woks  great but wish it had a bag
reviewDescription: Love this!  Has great suction.  Cleans up dog hair on carpets .  I just wish it had a a retractable cord . Cleaning out the container is a mess! Hair dust  is sucked up in container yes you can open it up and dump into the trash ,but hair gets stuck on the side of the container and either I have to put an object up the container  to remove the stuck debris or put my hand up in the container to remove the stuck debris .  I like the bag i can throw away much cleaner .

reviewTitle: Pretty good, but horribly short cord length
reviewDescription: The vacuum is actually great. It has really good suction, it's easy to clean, and it's not made out of cheap plastic. The only downside, is the cord length is absurd. It's the shortest cord I've ever seen on a vacuum. You have to constantly search for a new outlet to plug into, which is just plain annoying.
