Other than that, the vacuum itself is a good buy, although it is now $20 more than what it was just 2 months ago when I bought it for $69.
It worked great at first but it didn’t last.  Great suction and easy to use but the pet hair clogs up the top of canister.  It broke after just one year.  It’s too big to fit in small spaces.

Both times I tried to use this vacuum I sucked up a little piece of fabric and the belt pops off and does not spin any longer. You have to takeoff six screws in order to access the belt and put it back on. once you resume vacuuming try not soaking up anything because otherwise, you have to take all six screws off again. worst vacuum ever

Have Eureka AS 1008AX, got a freak clog, thought it bit the dust. Took apart fixed it.Did side by side comparison of Eureka NEU 181D and Eureka AS 1008AX.The NEU 181D is lighter, slightly taller. Cord is 104 inches shorter, the hose is much shorter and smaller diameter, useless to use on stairs unless they are barbie size.The AS 1008AX hose will stretch the length of 12 steps. The NEU 181D 6 steps.NEU 181D handle seems flimsy. Suction about the same.Both have a pet turbo brush.Instead of improving Eureka got Cheap.

It is an okay vacuum cleaner, however it has a major design flaw - motor air outrun is designed to be in front of the vacuum. It blows away all the dust in front of the vacuum before it can suck it in. Really frustrating every time when I need to clean tile/plank floors.

I was replacing my Hoover Wind tunnel that had a broken switch after 9 years...Big mistake.  I am 5'8''.The hose on this Eureka is only 32 in long with a stretch of about 6 more inches.  the crevice tool is only 7 in long.  If you only want  to vacuum the floor, it does have good suction.  If you want to reach something high the entire machine tips over onto the floor so no walls or drapes or bookcases can be done.  The hose/crevice combo is not long enough to reach under cabinets or between cushions and again the machine falls over if you attempt to stretch the hose even a little. The price was affordable in dollars but a fortune in frustration.
This doesn’t seem to have great suction at all and it’s extremely loud. I’ve never heard such a loud vacuum cleaner before I wish I would’ve returned it.

reviewTitle: You get what you pay for. Cheap.
reviewDescription: Sadly, this product is not a durable vacuum and has multiple issues to say the least. The handheld vacuum attachment for your upholstery doesn't work at all. Never has from out of the box. The suction quality is extremely lacking. The motor is just not enough for a standard household. Even on low carpet setting. It doesn't pick up hardly anything. Not only that, the thin plastic that it's made out of brakes very easily, it doesn't have a large capacity and overall just stinks.

This vaccum is ok. The bristles on the brush don't seem long enough to pull up hair from any length of carpet. It works well on bare floors though.  I would not recommend for anyone who needs to pull hair (human or animal) from carpeted or upholstered surfaces.
Should have invested in a better vacuum. It doesn’t have enough strength to suck up anything off my carpet or hard floors. It just flings it around!

I've had this vacuum for just shy of a year and it's already lost suction. I was using it, emptied the tank that wasn't full and then went back and noticed it just kept smearing the hair across the carpet rather than picking it up.I have german shepherds and a cat so I vacuum often, use a carpet rake and also use a carpet cleaner. By the time this vacuum stopped working and I was raking out imbedded hair, it became pretty obvious how little dirt and hair it was actually picking up, despite frequent vacuuming and carpet cleanings. The tank is small and holds less than other vacuums I've had in the past and other than it being light weight, there is nothing special about this vacuum to warrant the price.Unfortunately, this is the one product I apparently didn't get a warranty on, so it's going straight into the trash and I will purchase something that does a better job and actually picks up pet hair.Of all the many vacuums I've had to purchase over the last 7 years, I'm the least impressed with this one considering what I paid for it. I will go back to Bissell or Shark and avoid Eureka. It was my first and last purchase with them.

The vacuum itself is fine for the money. It has good suction, maybe too much. The attachments are good but don’t stay put on their racks. THE PROBLEM IS COMPANY POLICY.  I received the vacuum on Dec 07, 3023. By Dec 20, 2023 the belt broke. I called the company for replacement, and although the person was friendly and polite, the company policy denied me a fast replacement on a NEW MACHINE. THEY WANTED: pictures of the broken belt, model number and copy of warranty, written explanation of problem. This is a $3.50 item on a new machine!!!  Really??!!!  I ended up buying the belt myself, delivered the next day without problem. If a company won’t stand behind what they sell, DON’T BUY FROM THEM.
The suction is great and the smaller size make it fit into tight corners. I did not know it would require taking 6 screws out to get to the brush roller. Not happy with that.
If you have a shedding dog like me, this does clog easily. Love how it vacuums and mops all at the same time!
easy to use picks up everything lightweight , I'm happy
Don’t have to change vaccums because this does it all
Nice smaller vacuum. I've used it several times now and it does a fine job. The thing I was bummed about, there are extention pieces for the hose.
It is better than the last vacuum I had

I’ve had the vacuum for a month now and have an Australian Shepard/sheepdog mix that sheds ALOT!! This picks up EVERYTHING. It showed me what my old dirt devil wasn’t picking up. The attachments were easy to put in place. I’d recommend this to all pet owners.
There is a sharp turn for the dirt to get stuck in before going to the canister.u uasband had to do surgery to get a pen out?  How would it even suck up a pen?
Very good vacuum cleaner. Picks up alot and cleans great. Easy to assemble and to carry. Perfect size, too. The only downside is the cleaning of the filter and gets clogged easily.
Gave this vacuum as gift for my daughter and she loves it. She says it’s like a shampoo job when she uses it. Highly recommend!

Es una aspiradora potente, no estoy acostumbrado a su forma y me parece algo pesada, aun asi, su poder de aspirado es genial y recoge el pelo de mis 2 perros con facilidad, sus accesorios y la forma en que los lleva a todos encima todo el tiempo es genial pórque permite cambiarlos sin tener excusas por pereza de ir a buscarlos, es un poco incomoda de llevar el cable pero no es nada a lo que no se pueda acostumbrar
I vacuumed over what I previously did with my old vac. Filled the bag with dirt and hair.This thing works! Really like it.

Very easy to put together and use. Has a lot of suction power but still light weight. Switched back to this corded vacuum after trying a cordless for a couple years. Hated having battery die in the middle of cleaning and cordless had much less suction power. This is vacuum is a winner!

reviewTitle: Powerful but lightweight and easy to use.
reviewDescription: As others have stated, I vacuumed a large room with our existing cordless vac two days before this arrived, just vac'd with this and was amazed by how much it picked up that the cordless left behind.  The dust bin is very easy to remove and empty.  Very reasonable price as well.
It is super powerful, easy to clean, and lightweight to carry. Best vaccuum I have ever owned!
Funciona muy bien  es lo que yo quería
Easy to use, great suction, excellent versatility. Great value.
But I think this vacuum cleaner really sucks 😁
great on our carpet and the tools are great
Works as expected
Does it's job

reviewTitle: Very Good Vacuum, Until It Wasn't
reviewDescription: So, this was a solid vacuum for the first two months and then the brush roller quit spinning. It seems like I just got the short end of the stick with this one. I went through manufacturer and they are sending me a refund check. Shame it broke because it was a really good vacuum while it was working, did a great job on cat hair but with no brush roller it's turned into one of them old school restaurant sweep brooms. 4/5 based on the quality of it when it was working (I understand I probably just got an unlucky one), it was lightweight and did all we needed it to do. Unsure if we will buy another one or try another brand TBD

This vacuum is just ok. It’s not wonderful (the detachable part is not long-which means you have to bend). The cord is super long which I like bc you can move about the room. It does not clog up at all! Very easy to throw out the dirt!! It has strong suction. It is a nice looking vacuum. It does the job & it’s inexpensive !!! Hope this helped!
Simple and works as it should

Eureka Lightweight Upright Vacuum Cleaner. Took a chance on a low priced, but still a Eureka vacuum, and we're not disappointed. Loads of suction, adjustable height from bare floor to thick carpet. Bag-less, easy to empty, on-board tools, and did I say suction? Interesting that tools from other vacs do not fit the hose, since this one is inside, rather than outer fit. A few things to consider: the cord could be another 6 feet longer, hose is rather short, the roller is always on, even when using the hose or on bare floors. But I may have been spoiled by my old expensive vac!  Well worth the price, fast shipping, well packed.  We're happy!

It's light weight. Easy to use and carry. I have 3 dogs one being a husky so hair is everywhere. It picked it up with ease. The cord seem short but thats okay. Works really well.Vacuums are so much money to find a decent price one that gets the job done is always nice.

I received my vacuum today.  Assembly was a no-brainer.  I was very pleased with the quality and power.  I have a St. Bernard and 4 cats and it picked up the hair no problems.2 small drawbacks that keep it from full 5 stars.... the power cord is too short and it doesn't get to the edges the way I had hoped but worked well
Works great, powerful suction the cord is long enoughEasy to clean for sure just take the tank off clean it and put it backThe tank has big capacity you don't have to clean it everytime you use it

reviewTitle: It's sucks good, but also sucks bad
reviewDescription: Needed a 'real' vacuum for those times my cordless vacs aren't appropriate--like stairs, cracks/crevices, under appliances, or cobwebs, etc.Pros: light weight, good suction, dirt cup is easy to release and empty, & has onboard tools. Seems to pick up pet hair nicely.Cons:Power cord is way too short. I live in a small house, but still had to change outlets from one end of my livingroom to the other to be able to vacuum the whole room. Make sure you have an easy to access outlet in every room, or a handy extension cord.The hose is also way too short and extremely stiff. There are no hose 'extension tubes' to give it more length, so above the head cleaning is impossible unless you want to lift the entire unit in the air. Same with stairs--be prepared to lift the whole unit every 2-3 steps.The crevice tool is too short and too fat to be of much use other than in-between furniture cushions or easy to access baseboards and the like. It can't fit more than 3 inches under or between any appliances, unless you move the entire appliance. I expect it won't reach very far under/between car seats either.If a long hose and useful tools aren't important to you, this may be ok for you, as the suction capabilities are good. I'm going to keep searching for my next vacuum...

This vacuum is actually great. It really is. But the shortness of the hose is hilarious. It's nearly useless. It barely stretches from its connection to the vacuum to the other side. It definitely doesn't work for anything further than 4 feet away. Can't clean my vents. Can't clean fans. Not unless I want to hoist the whole machine up on my shoulder. I can't even reach behind my shelves. It's ridiculous. But, for the price, if you don't need any of the attachments to be useful, this is an otherwise great product.

Sooooo- for the price it’s fair. You get what you pay for.I should of known this has the twist and Empty receptacle, which they are a pain to empty. They are messy and never go back together easy. Takes few minutes to manage it so it aligns just right to put it back together. It’s LOUD!!!  There’s nothing quiet about it. It’s louder than my vacuum that’s 15 years old🤷🏻‍♀️With that said it seems to do ok, nothing fancy , it’ll get the basic jobs done. Perfect for the office but I’ll be getting a different one for my house. The tool use is a pain and not at all user friendly. There’s no rigid long pole for the tools to attach it’s a flex hose all the way, so your hands and knees when using the tools. Again that’s not ideal. The attachment area to pull out the hose to attach hand pieces is such a pain to use, the swivel doesn’t rotate right and it knocks the canister over. Overall this is a cheap vacuum with a terrible design. I really should return it & get something else.
Sweeper quit working only having it two months. Won't spin and won't pick up. Started out working great

reviewTitle: Sucks good but no wand for high places
reviewDescription: Overall, this vacuum was easy to assemble and has great suction and dirt storage capacity. But the cord was very short, there is no wand attachment for hard to reach areas and the floor dial is on the front of the vacuum so you can’t adjust it on the fly. The wheels are made of cheap plastic and they are already squeaky after just one use. The beater bar did get all the cat fur off of my fabric dining room chairs, but I had to stop several times to move the cord as it was too short to even vacuum my entire living room from one outlet. There is a strange hole in the back of the handle, and a sticker that states that the hole is intentionally there, but I’m not sure why! The design of the canister does not allow the vacuum to lay flat and get under the dining room table, as it is rather bulky.It did remove the very fine dirt from the area rug in the living room and overall, it seemed to get the job done, but I am not confident that it will last more than a year.

reviewTitle: This is an OK vacuum...not great
reviewDescription: This vacuum does the trick and works ok. It seems to be picking up most of the pet hair and dirt that is on the floor.  My issue with it came when I had to empty the cannister.  I have 2 dogs and 2 cats, so there is a lot of fur to be dealt with.  Once the cannister is about 1/3 of the way full, the fur stops being pulled down into the cannister. It just sits up around the filter and collects.  You have to completely dismantle the cannister to get to the filter, which means that you have to stick your hand in there with all the dirt,  fur, and whatever else you just vacuumed up.  I've owned several different vacuums, and this one is definitely not at the top of my list. I won't purchase this one again.

reviewTitle: Not as good as older Eurekas
reviewDescription: Unlike the much simpler dirt canister on our old Eureka Capture/ Pet Lover 8852BVZs, the new style "cyclonic" dirt canister is very difficult to properly clean.  Any stringy sort of trash can get wrapped around a central hard-to-reach fixture in the canister and requires a wire hook to reach and clean off.  The amount of dirt picked up by this new Eureka Blue PowerSpeed NEU280 with Washable Filter is at least a third less than our old Eureka (motor finally wore out after several decades of use).  The power cord is much shorter and requires us to jockey between electrical outlets twice as much.  Very disappointed; it feels cheap and is unlikely to last more than a few years, but it seems to mirror the throw away mentality of many products (more landfill trash).  Eureka is no longer making a superior vacuum sweeper.

reviewTitle: Very hard to maneuver. Gets the dust up but not easily
reviewDescription: Not as easy to maneuver. I find it hard to use when in low floor mode. $100 more dollars and i could’ve gotten a better vacuum smh. Does have a wooden floor mode. Does clean up cat hair and debris. However i can tell that in about 7-8 months, this vacuum will be trash unfortunately.

Im probably being too generous with the 3 star but it’s mostly because i can make the vacuum work for me. The best about this vacuum, and its saving grace, is that long black attachment piece. It works great and if i was rating that part only, it would be a 10/10. The suction is pretty nice and it gets the job done. Now for the rest of the vacuum, its a different story. Considering i bought the pet one, you would think it vacuumed pet hair, but it does not. And another thing is the amount of dust it blows everywhere. I read other reviews that said it blows air out the front and they were not kidding. Im sure its not the bad if your house isn’t to dirty but for deep cleans it becomes tedious.

it works as it should, but the placement of the hose causes it to tip over OFTEN when you use the hose separately.  the Eureka vac I had prior to this has a hose at the bottom of the machine and that worked much better.

reviewTitle: The belt comes off easily when vacuuming
reviewDescription: I’ve had the belt repeatedly become dislodge and stop spinning the brush as soon as it encountered any type of thicker rug. It does not effectively clean up the mess in thicker rugs on the lowest suction setting designed for the rugs. The product is just ok.
Doesn’t pick up well spits out dust. Cleaned out nozzles not happy with vacuum

Works if you don’t need to actually pick up any dirt. I should have saved my money and just bought a different vacuum. The suction is terrible. I have to go over the same are at least 4 times to have it thoroughly vacuumed. It constantly get clogged. I’m not talking about every once in a while. I mean every 5 minutes. I have used many many vacuums in my life and this ranks at the very bottom of my list.

After vacuuming for a month once -2 a week the product stopped working, it wasn't great with suction to start, but I have owned two of these vacuums, one for my office and one for home, and both have turned out not to last or work well.

reviewTitle: Eureka lightweight power vacuum cleaner over rated
reviewDescription: Hose is too small to reach under beds, etc. Same is true for attachment tools, which are ineffective. Too difficult to return so will use in basement.

This vacuum doesn’t suck well at all, it just pushes pet hair to the corners of my rug and leaves huge clumps of pet hair. I’ve been out of a vacuum for over a month now, so there is certainly a build up of pet hair, but nothing I’d expect a decent vacuum to have trouble with. I’m going to give it another chance tomorrow but if not, may be looking for another vacuum.

I purchased this vacuum because it was supposed to be good for rugs and hard flooring, but was lightweight.  My old Shark became inoperable, but I was pleased with its performance.  But this Eureka is below par!  Leaves large balls of rug fiber behind, does not suck it up.  On hard flooring it spits out debris from behind so I have to go back and re-vacuum it up.  The handle is so short it won't reach up to retrieve cobwebs from the ceiling.  I am of normal height and have to bend over a lot to complete even a mediocre cleaning.  Would not recommend at all!

reviewTitle: Suction powerful I can not vacuum my rugs
reviewDescription: Not sure what I can be doing wrong as all the reviews seem to be very positive, but I can not vacuum my rugs as the suction is so strong and you can smell the belt burning ..and yes I have tried all the settings. The rug in the picture is an example of the rug I’m trying to vacuum- very thin.  However this does work wonderful on all my hardwood floors
I would not purchase. I went back Shark vacuum cleaner.

Haven't had this thing a full year yet, and the carpet part no longer engages...just hard floor. The beater bar does not turn at all during any of the carpet choices. Also, the bottom cord keeps snapped off. Not worth the money.

reviewTitle: Light weight to a fault and so so-so design
reviewDescription: I have no problem with the suction power of this vacuum. two big problems that drive me nuts. first it is light weight, but if you use the hose for attachments or baseboard/crevice cleaning you must keep one hand on the unit or it will tip over with just the hose extended even a foot. After being hit in the head half a dozen times I don't even bother to use the attachments. Second the exhaust port is below the collection canister in the front and aims down so if you do have pet hair it will blow it all over the place before you can get it sucked up. I have since duck taped a piece of cardboard to deflect some of that tornado  blast. This would be an ok unit for the dorm room to clean up the dumped cereal, but that's about it. Going to  shop for a less frustrating vacuum.

While I will say this is much more lightweight than my old model, the suction isn’t great and a lot of air blows out pushing dust and fur away from the vacuum, even on the lowest setting. The tools don’t work very well, and are kind of difficult to maneuver. The tube for the tools is the main form of suction for the whole vacuum and has to be reattached to the base and it often pops off so you will randomly loose suction and then realize the hose is out. I miss my old pet vac, it lasted for years and years

I read reviews before purchasing, but decided to take my chances anyway. It does definitely feel cheap, but it IS cheap, so that's fair I guess.My biggest issue is that hose isn't part of the detachable wand. The product video made it look like you just detached the wand to get into crevices or at the ceiling or whatever, and then just pop it back in. However, the annoying reality is that you have to detach the hose from the vacuum base, secure it to the wand, detach that, use it, and then reverse the process. So it's not like you can simply whip it out as you go along, it's a whole procedure.The suction does seem to be very powerful, and that's the saving grace of this machine. I did not find the power cord to be too short, as some reviewers complained; and as for it getting in the way since it comes out of the base, I simply hold the cord up in my hand that's operating the machine.It's not a great vacuum, but it's okay and that's good enough for my basement.

reviewTitle: Came with a great recommendation--from a site that gets a commission!  :-(
reviewDescription: It's just average.  What really sucks (haha) about it is that this hot air (like an exhaust) blows out from the top on the front of the flat part (hope that makes sense).  Blows dirt around.  Very frustrating.  Hard to push and not as lightweight as they made it sound.  But it was only $85.00.

reviewTitle: Just okay! Has a high pitched whine that's terrible.
reviewDescription: The high pitched whine is hard to handle. May return. Would definitely NOT buy again.

reviewTitle: Blows out a lot of air, hose falls off quite a bit
reviewDescription: LOVED it at first, love the large canister to hold the dirt, I got it because I have a cat who sheds like crazy, and while it does suck it up, it BLOWS air out of the front blowing the cat hair all over the place which kind of defeats the purpose of what I need it to do

For the price the Vac has great suction power.  However, using the reach hose w/out additional attachments will cause the Vac to fall over during use and there is a high-pitched noise the Vac makes during use.  Capacity is large which is good so you don't have to empty it often during use.

Just unboxed and used this vacuum for the first time today. Bought it for the upstairs carpet as our Dyson, only 2 years old, is suffering battery failure on high setting. Decided we needed a corded vacuum so we could complete more than half a room at a time! The reviews were good and I agree this is a powerful little vacuum for the price. I was AMAZED buy the amount of dust and hair it picked up in a small area. Gross. I’m can’t believe we have been living with that! Just a few points.1/ Took me a while to locate the power on. I know, I should have just run downstairs and looked at the manual but I though it should have been obvious. You really have to look closely for the symbol but it is in a good place for a foot operated on switch. It would have helped if the symbol was colored as well as embossed.2/ the attachments kept falling off the vacuum so I’d have to stop and pick them up.3/ I pulled the hose to attach the brush attachment and a bunch of dust flew out onto the floor, which, thankfully I have a good vacuum to clean up. This happened each time I went to use the hose.4/ the machine is so light it falls over easily. I hope it doesn’t break5/ the release for the dust container is super easy but when I went to empty it I had to dig my hand up in there to get all the yuck out! It did not just fall effortlessly into the trash can. Now I few like I need a shower. Probably got stuck due to my long hair getting wrapped around the center cylinder. If you have short hair you will likely be fine.So overall, it is lightweight, has great suction and easy to use, but has those annoying little quirks that you probably get with most corded vacuums. Great value for the money.

This is a great product for floors, it has great suction and cleaning power. However, if you vacuum any small rug or such the belt breaks quickly. This version without a belt would be amazing! But for a rug person it is just too much trouble.

reviewTitle: EXAGERADAMENTE RUIDOSA, PESADA, NOS ASPIRA TAPETES PELUDOS
reviewDescription: El producto se ve de muy buena calidad, aspira muy bien, pero es EXAGERADAMENTE RUIDOSA, como el pedestal solo tiene movimiento vertical y no horizontal se hace muy pesada de manejar, por otra parte, en mi apto tengo tapetes altos que son peludos, no los aspira el rodillo se enreda.

reviewTitle: It's just ok.... Turbo Pet feature is a gimmick
reviewDescription: It has powerful, good suction!!. Easy to handle. Lighter than my Bissel. The cord is long.However if you want to use the attachments, the suction hose is too short, so the whole machine just tipps over. Very annoying and cumbersome.I tried using the "pet turbo" attachment. Forget it! It's impossible to use it - the suction hose is very short. the entire machine just tipps over, you struggle to somehow get to use that turbo pet attachment! Huge machine on the floor, you on all four trying to somehow..... forget it!!  It's a joke! I looked like Lucille Ball in I Love Lucy!! Hahaha.  Plus it doesn't do anything.My suggestion - the pet turbo thing is just a gimmick! There is an exact similar vacuum for $79. Get that one. This one is $89. You pay an extra $10 for a gimmick that doesn't do anything.The machine otherwise is good. I will keep it.  Just wasted an extra $10. Oh well...

Just received this item and have to say I'm impressed on how well it picks up. I really like the way it cleaned up the bare floors as well.  HOWEVER there are a few drawbacks that had I  known before buying, I probably would have a chosen a different model. 1. This item does NOT come with an extension wand for the hose and the hose on this is very short to start with. So if your planning on using this to reach higher places-it's not happening.  2. The cord on this is shorter than most of my other vacuums.
Okay for the money

The product is fine.The problem is Amazon and same issue several times!!Your product description says it is wet/dry vacuum, IT IS NOT.It also says that I would receive a pet tool and extra filter, DID NOT RECEIVE.
Wrong purchase. Needed a pet cleaner constantly get clogged. Requires deconstructing vacuum cleaner to remove dog hair. Maybe good for people with no dogs

I bought this because of the low price but still assumed high quality from Eureka. NO. It is very light, and its features are almost non-existent. The hose has to be moved from the base to the wand, the exhaust for the air is in the front of the vacuum and it blows dust all over the place when you're trying to clean. Worst of all, the belt broke in the first 2 weeks, and I had to order more (they're not very expensive or hard to replace, but that's not the point). We're going to order a "real" vacuum soon and keep this as a spare. Would not recommend.
Not a great vacuum by any means. Hose attachment is weird and not at all lengthy.

reviewTitle: Great power for value but terrible maneuverability
reviewDescription: I understand this is not a swivel steering, but something in the wheel/operating system is flaw. I have hardwoods with rugs and it refuses to be pushed in certain directions, my guess is opposite of the grain of the weaves on the carpet. I previously had a stick vacuum shark that had absolutely no trouble doing this. I would not recommend for people in my situation, stick to stick vacuums or find one thats self propelled.This thing has extremely strong suction though,  purposely purchased this due to its higher amperage and it did not disappoint in that field.
Dislike trying to remove the dust part, says once a month.. friend looked, it has to be disassembled, good price

I do not like the shorter hose on this model.  We have an older bagless Turbo Eureka that is very similar to this one but the hose is longer.  When using this newer one you cannot use the attachments to vacuum anything that is more than one foot from the machine.  Every time I tried to vacuum something behind a chair or under a table it would fall and hit me in the head.  I do not like this one and cannot recommend it because of the shorter hose.  It did work very well on vacuuming my carpet but it's not good for using attachments on anything else.

reviewTitle: This is second, Used Good Condition Eureka vacuum I received, first I returned. This one is better.
reviewDescription: Handle does not click in and stay fastened, but at least this one works otherwise. The first I ordered smelled hot and made bad noises. On the plus side, it seems to do a fine job on our short office carpet and bare floors. I can't complain for $40 and fast delivery!

I’ve tried uploading it being vacuumed on different surfaces but it seems like it doesn’t let me do that here. Anyways, from first glance and appearance it can be stored easily in small spaces, it lives in my closet and because it’s so compact, I’m able to place it anywhere in my house without it being in the way or that I even remember that it’s there. It’s much more lightweight than other vacuums I’ve tried out.I have kids so with the messes they make and the crumbs they leave, this vacuum makes heavy duty cleaning a much simpler task. I have 2 long shag rugs and this vacuum on the carpet setting will pull up dirt along with the crumbs that are on it, it does wonders. Then when I put it on the bare floor setting, I can do the rest of the floors no problem. The one gripe I have about it though is that even on the bare floor setting it will blow air sometimes when I move it along the floor, pushing debris away from vacuum slightly, but it’s not to say it isn’t a strong sucker, it sucks well.Clean up of it as well after I am done is quite easy. I just push a button and the dust/debris falls out easily. I am able to dump in the trash without manually removing with my hand. Other vacuums that I’ve tried that have a built in filter and no bag, I’ve always had the experience of having to remove the trash with my hand. Also cleaning it is easy. I just take it apart, wash with soap and water, scrub dirt away and let it air dry, and it will look new.

I love this vacuum. I have two pugs and a cat so I have to vacuum every day but this thing picks up a decent amount of hair. I also use it on my kitchen floors sometimes when I'm too lazy to sweep so it works great on all flooring.My only criticism is the attachment features. When I take the handle off, there's some moisture trapped in the compartment for some reason. My vacuum is sitting in a dry corner of my hallway so idk how that could happen. Also, if you're using the hose, the vacuum smells a little smokey for sitting in one spot. It's nothing to be concerned about, it's just a weird smell.However, despite all that, it picks up everything, including fine kitty litter. I still recommend it.

In terms of usability, the Eureka Vacuum excels. Its lightweight design and swivel steering allow for effortless maneuverability, navigating around furniture and obstacles with ease.With its array of attachments, including a crevice tool, upholstery brush, and dusting brush, it transforms into a versatile cleaning companion capable of conquering every nook and cranny of the home. Whether reaching high ceilings, tight corners, or delicate surfaces, these attachments make quick work of even the most challenging cleaning tasks.the only drawback i found was that the cord length was too short.. but other than that highly recommend

This should not be considered as the only vacuum for your house. It has excellent suction for cleaning carpets. However, the vacuum hose is rather short and stiff, making it of limited use for overhead cleaning. Additionally, because of the light weight, the vacuum is prone to falling over when using the attachments. The attachments are not very robust and the crevice tool is very short and stubby, making it of limited usefulness. Being a low cost appliance, there is no light on the front of the vacuum and the beater bar doesn’t shut off when using it on hard floors. This allows debris on the floor to be blown away due to the air flow created by the beater bar.

reviewTitle: Careful taking out of the box
reviewDescription: This is a great vacuum too bad it's held together by a small piece of plastic which I broke trying to get it out of the box
Easy assembly, great price for a great vacuum.
I like the vacuum. It does a good job. The only problem I found is that it is difficult to close the dust cup lid after it has been cleaned out.

I think this vacuum is good and does great in my hardwood floors with lots of power. The attachments work well with the exception of the turbo brush. This is the attachment I really needed. Used it on my couch (have a lab) to remove any dog hair even though she doesn’t get on furniture. I assumed the rotating brush would help but it does not spin if apply any pressure. So pretty much just a suction as the other attachments. So if u want a spinning brush attachment I’d suggest another brand.

I have tried EVERY FREAKING VACC that is supposed to be for “small spaces, and lightweight” other than the viral Dyson because let’s face it… i’m just not gonna pay that if its not the best. But i got this on a deal, read the reviews and WOW i am so glad i did. What my other 5 vaccs didnt pick up even my parents OG dyson… this baby did. I wanna clean everything lol.

The Eureka Lightweight Powerful Upright Vacuum Cleaner works well, very good suction & is a good standard vacuum cleaner.  Gave 4 stars as it doesn't have headlights nor swivel feature (as my former one did) but really needed one & can't get a more expensive one at the moment so this one works fine!  Would recommend if you need a decent vacuum cleaner for a more affordable price.
This product is very heavy especially carrying up & down steps. Performance is great.
Super
I replaced my Bissell with this Eureka. The Bissell cleaned deeper in the carpet than Eureka.

reviewTitle: Gets the job done well enough
reviewDescription: After about 2 months of use, this vacuum is holding up fine and has decent (not superb) suction.  The bagless feature works well, and the on board hose and tools are convenient. The tools sometimes fall off their spots.  Don’t bother buying the “pet hair” small brush attachment—it’s only air and thin rubber band driven and stops as soon as it meets resistance.  The rest do the vacuum works fine—we have mostly hardwoods and a low pile area rug.  The vacuum is a little louder than our last one.

reviewTitle: Great! Suction is almost too strong!
reviewDescription: Love this for low pile area rugs and stairs! And love the attachment for cleaning the car interior.Only drawback. The vacuum suction is so strong, it will suck up and mangle anything that is not fully secured to the floor. For smaller or high pile rugs you will have to use the hose with attachment.  My previous Eureka allowed me to vacuum rugs without trying to eat them (when on high carpet setting).
Love it, very powerful.

reviewTitle: Powerful, efficient but a bit too noisy
reviewDescription: For my home with both wooden floors and low carpeting. This is a handsome piece of vacuum, well worth  the price of $79. Easy to push around and switching between types of flooring is easy. I've had this since January 2023 and use it regularly for the entire 1000 square foot house. So efficient that you're done before you know it: 25 minutes and my floors are clean as a whistle.WHY 4 STARS AND NOT 5: Well, it is powerful (which is good) and so the machine is a bit noisier than I like. Put on your ear phones and play some early Miles or Beethoven. The only other irritation is that it's hard to unwrap and rewrap the conveniently long extension cord. Other reviewers have also pointed out the bottom notch to wind the cord around is behind the loop of the suction tube. Difficult to wrap or unwrap the extension cord. I'm used to it now - hold the suction tube a few inches away.
It works fine but lacks the cord retracting feature of our previous Eureka.  Cleans very well.  Great value for the money.

reviewTitle: So for 75 dollars this does the job okay.
reviewDescription: There are definitely some cheap design elements in this but also you get what you pay for decent on carpet could be better on hardwood and laminate -  seems to pickup a good amount I need to change the receptacle for dirt every 3-5 uses. Also it seems Like if you don’t keep at least one wrap of chord around the back the cable is prone to getting caught under the wheel this is frustrating and caused me to fray the chord slightly.  I repaired with electrical tape. Still if you need a vacuum and you’re in a smaller space this is a definite go. Especially if you get it in 3 no interest payments from Amazon as I did.

reviewTitle: A lot of power easy to clean
reviewDescription: It picks up well, wish the hose was a little longer but it does the job.
The last one I bought lasted 7 years :) it’s a sturdy and durable vacuum
way better than my hoover. deep cleans carpet and weighs far less. easy to push.

The vacuum is INCREDIBLE. Listen I’ve been using a Mi*** vacuum for the past several years. Recently I purchased a Water filtration vacuum (you know the one that starts with an R and costs about $2,700.) when my old one bit the dust. Although I must say that yes it cleans well and the filtration is unparalleled…IT’S a PITA to use! I have two Dogs a chihuahua and a German Shedder, so I must vacuum almost daily. The other one is better for deep cleanings and when you have the time to really use it to its max potential… but for use everyday? It’s too much. Thats where this Eureka power speed came into play. I wanted to spend around $100 for a “daily driver”. I received this today and was super excited to put it together and get her purring. WOW JUST WOW. I literally vacuumed yesterday and the amount of dander, dirt and sand that this vacuum cleaner pulled out in a 5x5 area of carpet has me questioning a lot of things. First of all where did all this come from? And why did my EXPENSIVE vacuum not get it!?! I could have saved SOOOO MUCH MONEY. needless to say I’m in love and my neighbor who thinks that our other vacuum is amazing will be inheriting it in the morning! EUREKA! they have really SUCKED ME OUT OF THE WATER! (Pun intended) please get this vacuum. You won’t regret it.

I love this vacuum. It made of quality material, it is easy to use. Easy to put together. It does a wonderful job cleaning my carpet and wood floors. It is not too heavy, light enough to move vacuum with ease.
This is such a handy little vacuum! Lightweight, easy to use, all gadgets fit right on the machine so they are handy when you need them! Would buy again!
Me encanta  su funcionalidad  lo único  que  no me gusta es que se calienta  cuando  ya tienes unos 10 minutos de  uso

As if there aren’t enough good reviews of this product… I’ll leave one more. This was the canister after vacuuming *1* bedroom which I *thought* was clean! We had just vacuumed a few days prior. We have a dog and two cats all of which spend the majority of their time in this room. I am so surprised at how well this vacuum worked considering the price!
This is a great vacuum for pet hair. I had a carpet covered in cat hair and this cleaned it up quick. Powerful . Easy to use and put together. Emptying trap is easy too.

I did not realized I ordered the wrong vacuum until it was delivered. I am very happy I did not send it back. I vacuum my entire townhome and cleaned out my ducts. This vacuum is light and very easy to use. Do not pass up on this beauty!

reviewTitle: Lighter weight vaccum that still picks up pet hair and excels in deep cleaning thick carpet
reviewDescription: I was more than pleased with the ease-of-use of this vacuum. Does extremely well on both thick and thinner carpet. The uphostery attachment  did an excellent on pet hair on the furniture. Price is more than reasonable for such high level performance.

I have always had Hoover vacuum cleaners. When my Hoover quit I looked at product reviews and the Eureka seemed to be the best bet for the money.The suction is very good. It was simple to assemble. It is very similar to the last vacuum I owned. The cord is long, although I would prefer an automatic cord winder. Unfortunately, this vacuum is all made of plastic, which everything is now, but I am very pleased with this Eureka so far.

reviewTitle: Not a bad vacuum for the price
reviewDescription: I bought this vacuum on PRIME day. and I love it. the only down fall is the pet attachement head. you have to hold it at a weird angle to get it to work and when you do that it tends to fall off. but other then that my whole house it tile and it works great. GREAT BUY  when you dont want to spend a lot of money.

reviewTitle: Will take a little getting use to but should be okay....very, very, very loud
reviewDescription: I think it will be fine once I get use to using it....I had my previous vacuum cleaner for over 20 years.  Also, it is very loud but I will get use to it.
We've had Dyson's and Shark vacuums in the past. This model Eureka is not on that level of quality, however for the significantly lower price it works just fine.

reviewTitle: Impressive, little vacuum cleaner, lightweight, and affordable
reviewDescription: I was originally looking to get a Dyson or something comparable but didn’t want to pay the Dyson or top-tier price on a vacuum. I use the occasionally, this one popped up, decided to go for it, and could not be happier with this little vacuum cleaner. Only drawback is The short hose does not have much flex. Other than that, it’s great for all lengths of carpeting and Bere floors.

I bought this vacuum to replace my older Eureka vacuum that I had for many years. This vacuum is lightweight & has a powerful suction but the cord seems a bit shorter & it does not have an auto-coil cord holder, which was one of my favorite things about my older model. Overall a good vacuum.

This vacuum works amazing for the price point! We have used it in carpet and kitchen tiles. The suction works really well and we don't need to sweep the kitchen floor anymore. Very lightweight. However, the cord isn't too long, compared to our previous one. Also you have to be very careful with the wire because ours has totally started chipping off in several places within a couple of uses. The wire on it is not good quality or sturdy so exchanging it for a new one.
light, nice recommend

The exhaust on this vacuum is in the font just above the floor piece. What that means is that unless you have the vac reclined a good bit, everything you want to vacuum is blowing away in front of it, like cat hair and litter. The hose is not 7 feet long. When I use the hose and attachment head to vac cushions the unit is right next to you and falling over. The attachments fall off constantly while using. On the plus side it does a good job on carpet and its easy to dump the dirt from the canister. BUY the replacement filters for the top of canister now as you will use them.
I like this vacuum a lot. It was easy to put together and does a good job cleaning the floors. I do wish that the back would lower down more to get further under furniture.

This vacuum sucks...but in a good way.  Replaced a 15 year old Dyson with this Eureka (didn't want to spend 5x on the Dyson).  I don't ever recall my other vacuums with this strong of a suction.  It catches everything my family drops in the carpet.  It's also lightweight and easy to maneuver.  It could use a longer power cord but that's a very minor issue.

I am usually a Hoover buyer, but didn’t have a lot of money to spend. This vacuum has great suction ability. The pet turbo attachment actually works after 5 minutes. Cord is long enough and I had seen people don’t think hose is long enough when you use attachments.  I think it does the job. I am pleased. Only  down fault  is canister and everything else besides tube for attachments is very lightweight plastic. Also you have to be careful on how you pick it up by handle on canister

Perfect size. Perfect weight. Strong suction. Gets pet hair up really easily. I have mostly hard, concrete flooring then one room has carpet. It cleans all of them really well. The cord is long so I don’t have to move the plug too much. Very good quality for such a cheap price. Really versatile from hard floors to carpet to using the extender to reach hard places.

reviewTitle: Wouldn’t believe it if I hadn’t seen it!
reviewDescription: Now be skeptical if you want, but I read reviews and decided it was worth trying. I have a German Shepherd who does serious shedding. Hair everywhere, all day everyday. This vacuum IS A BEAST!! Unbelievable amount of hair vacuumed! If you are on the fence I recommend buying, you won’t regret it! I have an Electrolux, but wanted something less bulky to be able to use regularly. I’m just shocked by how well it works! You won’t be disappointed!!

So I believe in vacuuming often like ..everyday and I have had a shark but moved and wanted to try a new brand and I vacuumed with the shark and this thing got up SO MUCH MORE .it cleans super good ,easy to use and perfect size ,it doesn’t clog up and gets deep into the carpet ,the picture is of what the shark left in the living room then I immediately used this one to test it to see if it would pick up more and the picture speaks for itself

By far the best vacuum! Super easy to use! Easy to clear. The size of it isn’t unbarrable. It doesn’t take up to much space. I love the versatility! I can use it on carpet, hardwood and walls! Yes I said walls! The cord could be a little longer but it’s not terrible in length!

I don't have a lot of carpet in my home. My old vacuum just want cutting it so I bought this one. This works great.  So good in fact that silly me didn't adjust the setting and had it set so low that it sucked up the strings of my carpet and I had to cut it off. That was my fault though. Point is it works on wood floors or carpets. Had a long cord that in didn't feel the need to keep searching for the next outlet to plug it in. Light enough to carry up and down stairs. Easy to empty canister. Had a nice holler to wrap the cord back up on. My only problem is that one of the accessories that hooks on at the top sometimes falls. But that's not a deal breaker just got to put it on just right. I would buy again.

I LOVE this Vacuum ! I can’t believe it’s power. Cat hair, cat litter, etc! All gone! It is the vac I wish I had years ago. I’m actually glad my old one died. This new one will make my life easier saving time and effort.

This vacuum is a powerful little guy. I love not having to sweep my floors before mopping. It has zero trouble picking up all the dog hair and mine for that matter. Best part is it’s light weight and my kids like to vacuum now.

Man this vacuum rocks!!! I just got it. Put it together, and used it. It picked up a ton of stuff my old vacuum did not!! And so light weight! Just so happy with it! You won’t be sorry buying this for sure!!! 👍👍👍👍
I thought it would suck better.
So noisy vacume
This vacuum is strong and it does vacuum well. However I've had so many issues with it since buying it, bands breaking , not normal noises etc... I would never buy it again.
Made out of plastic.  It feels cheap.  I hope that it holds up. I wish that it had cord rewind. The cord could be a little longer.
Not lightweight at all.  The hook to connect to the front of the sweeper to hold an attachment is missing.  The suction is not that strong.

reviewTitle: Very hard to clean dust out
reviewDescription: And harder to put back together or contact them. The size and suction were nice but i had to trash it. The dust cup would not stay in place either.

I ordered one and I thought it was damaged because it was too darn loud. So, I had it replaced for one more of the same model. I got the second one and it is as loud as the first one. It works GREAT, it does what it says it will do and it is super light. I will be sending the second one back also.

This vacuum is larger than expected and appears to be very good for professional cleaning.  It's not the type of vacuum you would take out to pick up crumbs or small items/touch ups.  It is for big jobs.  I am average in size and weight and found this vacuum to be much heavier than described.  Very clumsy for stairs.

I use this vacuum for wood floors and area rugs. On the plus side, it is lightweight and easy to  push. I like how convenient it is to empty the collection canister and that I don't have to deal with vacuum bags. On the downside, it is so lightweight that when you go to use the hose, the whole vacuum falls over. The hose does not stretch as much as I'd like and could be longer. It can be very frustrating trying to vacuum when it is constantly falling over. The reason I gave it 3 stars, though, is that after only 2 months of using the vacuum, the rotating brush was cut by a string that had unknowingly gotten caught around it. I have never had a string cut through the plastic on a vacuum (see photos)! At least I was able to easily  replace the part by ordering it on Amazon. It does make me suspect that it might be a common problem, though.
The floor brush doesn’t stop spinning when the vacuum is upright, which is extremely inconvenient.

I have 3 cats and I own a Homeika Stick Vacuum, it is great on hardwood but doesn’t work on carpets at all and with it being summer my cats are shedding a lot. With 3 passes over my area rug you can really tell a difference! This vacuum has so much suction and works on hard wood, and any kind of carpet. So much suction that my small 2x3 carpet doesn’t stay in place when I vacuum over it. Definitely not a deal breaker though. Has so many attachments and dirt bucket is huge. Cord is very long and vacuum is not too heavy. Highly recommend if you have pets and carpets!!

Love this vacuum.  Very inexpensive but works great.  Dog hair is an issue and picks up very well.  However, I did receive one more attachment than there was a place for it and no real diagrams to help.  But I looked as did my husband and no where that works.

reviewTitle: This vacuum sucks! In a good way!
reviewDescription: Purchased this to replace an older model that gave up with a snap and a blue spark.  This new one is lighter, less noise, better design and bigger wheels.  Works great, sucks up everything that’s in front of it.  I currently work at a construction site and it has no issue with the debris off my work boots at the entry way.

I was concerned that for such a good price that it would not work well.  I was wrong! It does a great job on all my floors. I have a huge hairy German Shepherd and it sucks it all up! Great for a very reasonable price.

I use this vacuum for literally everything! The quality is absolutely amazing. This vacuum has great suction power and ZERO clogging. It is very easy to use and comes with many different connections for the vacuum. Can be used for carpet, hard wood floors, in between cracks, on furniture or even in the car. I am just amazed as to how great this vacuum is!!
Great little vacuum cleaner, very light weight, Long cord. Everything in accessible on board the vacuum. Powerful suction and easy to maneuver. I would definitely recommend this vacuum cleaner.
I have a expensive shark and roomba.  I bought this for my parrots room.  It is very impressive.  I would recommend and feel its a really good deal for the price point.

reviewTitle: Does exactly what I want.  Has ability to go from deep shag to hardwood.
reviewDescription: My shark had a hard time with the deep carpet, that was my only complaint, but it was enough to drive me to purchase this.  This machine isn't really super light, but I tell you it really takes care of business on the first floor and the shark has been changed into the "second floor and stairs" vacuum.

reviewTitle: Easy to set up and use, does the job well
reviewDescription: I was surprised by how easy this vacuum is to set up and use even without looking at the guide, and also how efficiently it cleans an area. It really does pick up a ton of dust. It does not have the best maneuverability if you are looking to clean tight spaces, but I feel the attachments can adequately adapt to this issue.

I bought this vacuum about a year ago. My daughter "borrowed" it and I finally said "just keep it." So I  went straight back to this one! It is by far the best vacuum cleaner I have EVER owned. I am 73 yrs old. I've owned them all. They don't compare to this one. Look how much pet hair and dirt it picked up with a few passes over a 9'X12' low nap rug! The engineers and instruction writers are on point with the assembly! So easy, I quickly put it together by myself. (I'm a single retired woman.) Kudos, Eureka! Not only would I buy it again, but I DID buy it again! Love it!

reviewTitle: Works great for pet hair on furniture
reviewDescription: It works great, the only negative is that it's incredibly loud.

I've been through way too many vacuums (they certainly don't make them like they used to) and every style from rechargeable stick vacuums,  dust busters, cannisters, to uprights for carpeting, and this one is by far the best! I've tried other upright vacuums for hardwood floors, and they didn't work as well as they did on my carpets, but THIS one works phenomenal on my hardwood floors! The powerful suction is absolutely amazing! Way better than stick and canisters!! I have 4 cats and 2 dogs, and the hair that this Eureka Pet Turbo picks up is beyond amazing! I do clean it out after every use to make sure that nasty stuff doesn't stay in the cup, but that is super easy to do! Just hold it over my trash can and release! The reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is that the vacuum is not very sturdy when using the hose/attachments. It tends to fall over very easily, but with a little maneuvering to keep it sturdy, the suction makes up for that. I vacuum my floors pretty much every day, but I also put on the brush attachment and do my dusting too! The Eureka Pet Turbo is a must have if you have pets!
It is a little noisy but nice and  light

reviewTitle: This Vacuum cleaner Sucks! In a good way!
reviewDescription: I finally gave up on my Dyson.. And took a chance with this cleaner. And I couldn't be MORE pleased. I'm obsessed with vacuuming now. I always felt like my carpets were dirty even after vacuuming. And I was right! My pictures are AFTER vacuuming with my old Dyson. Filled the canister 3 times just for the living room. And my Shag is back!! It's not a matted up mess like it was! Highly recommed this vacuum. No it doesn't have a huge reservoir and the hand tool hose is worthless. But for the money and what I got it for is right on.

reviewTitle: It sucks great haha but it’s loud and bulky.
reviewDescription: I am pleased with the cleaning ability, the size of the rubbish container and the ease of the attachments but it doesn’t go under our cabinets because it’s a bit bulky. Don’t get this it you want the ability to go under beds and things easily.
It is ok for now

I had originally purchased an Amazon brand vacuum for the compact size a little over a year ago and the thing just sucks...or didn't suck and that was a problem so after seeing the reviews I went with this one.Assembly was very straightforward, took less than 5 minutes and didn't even require the extensive owners manual they provided.  This thing works great.  My apartment carpet looks as good as when I moved in, and I have a cat that sheds constantly.  The large bagless collection tank is nice as well; about twice as large as the former one I had.The only thing that could make this vacuum better is if the detachable hose was about a foot longer.I'm very pleased with this product!

This vacuum has a lot of suction and does a good job of picking up cat hair.  The cord is nice and long.  Too long for some jobs but you can't unwrap part or the cord.  The cord is hinged on the top of the motor so you end up running over it.  It should be hinged part way up the handle.  The motor blows air out the front of the motor and it blows any loose papers  on tables or sofa around the room.
On bare floors, there is so much suction going on that it blows some of the lighter debris around instead of sucking it up.  Several passes to get all of it.  Works great on carpet.
Highly recommended. Fairly light and easy to handle. Cleans carpet and flooring very good.

I LOVE this vacuum! I have two cats and they are constantly shedding and when I used this for the first time, I could not believe how much hair and debris it picked up that my old vacuum left behind. Very good suction and bag less to. I emptied it three times after vacuuming my apartment! I highly recommend this vacuum - especially if you have pets. I would give it ten stars if I could!

This vacuum really gets up the dirt and pet hair. Has great power. Easy to push. Love all the on board attachments. For some reason the small oval brush opening is too small and it doesn’t fit on board like all of the other attachments. This is my first Eureka and love it. I won’t buy a dirt devil ever again.
This vacuum picked up more kitty fur from my carpet than what I ever realized was on the floor.
Perfect price, great vacuum for hardwood floors and carpet with dog hair and dust. Don't hesitate buy it!

Back in the day, and yes I'm old enough to remember, they used to sell you vacuum cleaners door-to-door and some guy in a suit would knock and there he would be with this artillery looking unit with 8,000 attachments and they would try to sell you vacuum cleaners that not only clean floors but pureed fruit, steam cleaned curtains, sharpened knives, but nowadays things are very different.Nowadays people buy a vacuum cleaner they use it and abuse it and eventually it quits working, and there's no retirement program for old vacuum cleaners so coming from our world of toss it out and get a new one, it was time for me to get a new vacuum cleaner since we have a German Shepherd and there is hair everywhere.I recommend this vacuum cleaner because the front end brushes reach closer to the floor and carpet and grab everything in sight. It has the no bag system so you unclick the chamber open it up and dump everything out. This vacuum cleaner has tremendous suction. It has a great front end brush. They're really cool feature about this vacuum cleaner is the handle comes off and you have an extended hand vacuum cleaner and you can slap on the attachments as well. As I'm vacuuming I can pull the handle and vacuum the hair off the couch suck up the dust in the corners and grab a few cobwebs on the wall. As a sidebar I wish to note that although I use this vacuum cleaner a lot my house is clean and it's not as dirty as I'm making it out to be but but I am pointing out that this little unit was very affordable less than a hundred bucks and it works better than some of the other fancy more expensive vacuums that cost a fortune.In closing I also want to add that you can easily take this thing apart and clean the inside the brushes to the point that it's working at a new level again.Highly recommend this vacuum cleaner and I was not compensated or rewarded for saying nice things.
Lightweight, many vacuum configuration options, easy to maneuver, easy to empty/clean out dust canister.  Would recommend!

I love this little vacuum cleaner the nice thing about it is you can dump whatever you pick up off the floor immediately into the trash and you can see what you’re picking up from your floor. Very nice. You don’t have some dust bag sitting in your closet.
All the floors are debri free! Holds so much dirt before you have to empty it

This vacuum is decent quality for the price and suction is great. We have dogs and cats and ferrets and the floors actually feel clean after I vacuum. Great on both carpeting and multi surface floors as well.

I love everything about this vacuum.  I bought it a year ago.  I love the way there are no bags to empty.  I love the suction.  I love the long cord.  I love how easy it is to pull and push.  I love how light weight it is.  When you empty the receptacle, you can wash it and all of a sudden you've got a brand new clean machine.  Eureka customer service is fantastic.  I had an issue and emailed them and they resolved it within a day.  I just can't say enough good things about this machine.  I just bought another one for a different floor.

reviewTitle: This Vacuum Barely Lasted 2 Months!!! Very if not Extremely Disappointed
reviewDescription: This vacuum would squeak when it was being moved, which was a very unpleasant noise. It also struggles to suction up the filth from the carpet. It even started spewing out dust all over the carpet making it dirtier. I would not recommend this Vacuum. We even at one point cleaned the vacuum to see if it would improve the quality of it. It did not. I hope future potential vacuum buyers take note of this review. Do not avoid spending the extra money for a better quality vacuum.

This vacuum  is very lightweight. It does work well on carpet but there is no extension for the brush attachment. This means you have to bend down to only get about a 3 ft reach when cleaning in corners, along baseboards and on stairs. Too frustrating. I’m sending it back.

This vacuum constantly gets clogged up, throws debris back out, and can barely handle anything. Might work if you live in already really clean brand new apartment. But I wouldn’t recommend for most. So disapointed after trying to fix time and time again over 2 years of use. It’s so bad I’m not even going to try to resell or give a way for free. I wouldn’t want to treat my neighbor this way. Therefore, I’m just going to take it straight to the scrap yard.

I gave Eureka a chance and sorry to say this vacuum is disappointing.  1. The suction does not cyclone enough in the container and everything gathers up top.  This means you either have to dig your hand up to the top and pull the log jam of dirt and fur out or take another mechanism off to empty it.  It's not a simple, open and shake.  This is advertised as a pet vacuum but it struggles to move the hair into the container  2. The hose to use the attachments doesn't come with an extender tube - that means it's so short that the vacuum constantly tips over if you try to use the hose.  3. One of the attachments already broke.  4. At the lowest floor setting lots of reverb goes out the back of it so you have to look behind you and go back and vacuum what shoots out the back.  It's lightweight and affordable so those are positives.
Have always liked Eureka products and very disappointed in my new Eureka Bagless vacuum.  In a month I've only used it once because putting dust cap back onto vacuum was so frustrating.

.. it gets the fur but if there's even the slightest pebble like thing in the way, sand or otherwise.. it flicks it rather than sucking it up more than enough for me to be dissatisfied.but hey.. it gets the "fur" right...

reviewTitle: Great on hard floors, terrible on rugs
reviewDescription: I needed a vacuum that could easily transition from hard floors to area rugs.  Based on reviews, I went with this one.  It does great on hard floors.  But on rugs, it sucks up area rugs to where I can’t even move it.  It’s like the rug forms a seal around the vacuum.  I’ve had this thing for 6 months now and at first was able to put the carpet height switch where I could manage on the rugs.  Now no matter if I have it set on high carpet (none of my rugs are high carpet), I cannot push it on any of my rugs.  Therefore, it is worthless on carpet.  If I am able to push it all, it doesn’t even pick up obvious crumbs.  And it’s really loud.  I definitely would NOT recommend this vacuum!
The vaccum is way to loud

Top vortex clogs immediately with any substantial quantity of dog hair. Probably not an issue with short haired dogs. Our Huskies have always been vacuum killers. This vacuum is pathetically EASY prey.
Really liked the vacuum but it unfortunately didn’t even last me a year

This vacuum has suction power. So much so that it is hard to vacuum throw rugs or bathroom rugs. It sucks them up and wont let go. It is a little awkward to use, but what dan you expect for an inexpensive vac. It is easy to empty.

The sweeper picks up well on carpet or bare floor. The power cord is too short and the way it was designed were it comes out of the sweeper it is very easy to run over the cord. There is a little cord hook to use which kind of keeps it out of the way,but caution should still be used. Also,the hand pet attachment does not work well. It's easy to take apart to clean,but constantly needs attention.

This vacuum was a good price so I thought I would give it a try. It does have a decent selection, however, there are a few things that they need to improve on this design. First of all it does not come with an extra attachment so the hose is very short when you’re trying to vacuum furniture, baseboards, etc. I’ve never bought a vacuum cleaner before that did not come with the extra plastic piece so you could make it longer. The area that collects the dirt is super narrow and stuff gets stuck up inside and it’s almost impossible for you to stick your hand up there and grab the stuff that is sticking and pull it out. I have super tiny hands and I cannot reach all the way up in there to pull out what gets stuck and stuff is always stuck in there after each time I vacuum. I probably won’t buy this again.
It was very nosey to run.

It’s an okay vacuum for the price. For me, the price is the best thing about it. For a senior,  bending over to switch from hard floors to carpet is not pleasant and I have area rugs so if it isn’t on the right setting its impossible to move and if it’s on the easiest or next to the easiest setting , then I’m not sure it’s cleaning effectively.  Doesn’t have a light and it doesn’t swivel.  But like I said, it’s okay for the price.
This vacuum cleaner is very noisy it does pick up well I don’t like the way you have to wind up with the cord and the cord isn’t very long

Pros:Upright gives those with mobility issues (like me) something to hang onto.Cannister means no more bags. Also means I can vacuum up heavy debris that a bagged vacuum can't.Adjustable Height for carpets, rugs, and bare floors. Almost replaces my broom.Cons:Short, manual rewind cord is good for only one room (or less). Then I have to unplug it, rewind the cord manually, and roll this vacuum to the next outlet.Insufficient onboard attachments means I have to go hunt for extension wands every time I vacuum. Then attach them to this vacuum. Then get my vacuuming done. Then return the extension wands.Handle has a huge, hollow hole at the top. Why? It makes ZERO sense.This is a decent upright vacuum. I prefer it over those light-weight "easy-to-move" vacuums because I can actually use this. But it has it's flaws. Eureka, please take note: Add more attachments, put a cord rewinder on, and remove the gaping hole at the top of the handle?It's already hard to vacuum when one can't move around well. Stop making it harder.

reviewTitle: Works good but came with frayed cord
reviewDescription: The vacuum itself is very nice and works well but the cord was frayed out of the box, before I even plugged it in :(

reviewTitle: Underwhelming, get what you pay for
reviewDescription: this thing is okay i guess for the price. i broke my bissell 2998 and that's the only reason i ended up buying this eureka. i gotta say, it just doesn't have the same kind of suction power / just isn't nearly as effective and maneuverable as the bissell, and seems to leave a lot more hair in the carpet. finna buy another bissell and just try to not break it this time ._.

This vacuum is VERY loud.  It clogs easily with pet hair, so constantly stopping to clean out the upper canister.  Works well if all you plan on doing is vacuuming the floor, hardwood or shag carpet.  The hose and tools are a JOKE!!  The hose end does not stay attached and awkward to use.  The small roller tool has no power head so it does not turn if you put any pressure on it. Guess you get what you pay for.
It's got alot of attachments very easy to clean very good quality, easy to use, and perfect size

The old vac we had gave out and I decided to buy a Eureka based on reputation and reviews. We have several cats and the pet attachment was a type we had before. For those complaining that the brush doesnt turn, a light touch is what you need to use.Overall very satisfied with this vac. Even with some of the short comings I'd very much recommend buying this vac.Pros: Good strong suction! It also has a lower sound which is better than the high pitched sound of other vacs. Large dirt container. Good attachment holders. Easy to release the handle and turn on/off. Easy height adjustment. Washable filter.Cons: No extension tube attachment for better reach. Using the handle is awkward and not enough reach. I kept the extension attachment from our old vac. Power cord could be longer. The exhaust blows out of the front which tends to blow the cat hair away.Recommendations to Eureka: Redirect the exhaust and use a simpler handle with regular extension attachments.
I like the light weight.  It cleans laminate flooring very well.  It is all plastic, we will see what breaks first.
2 of the brush attachments are missing but the vacuum is great.

Vacuum suction is good.good for pet hair. I have 4 cats. Use daily. Needed something cheap, only dislikes are. Really short hose. Has to stay attached to you or it falls over, also when using hose roller is spinning from bottom, shoots debris,  also no light
I’ve had standard vacuum cleaners for years and this one works like the others. I wish it were a little less heavy.
Do what is it has to do, good quality and price
Not what I was expecting. It’s small, but very good suction and vacuums up dog hair on the carpets.

Nice little inexpensive vacuum.Easy to put together.  Easy to empty the dirty cannister.  Vacuum is very light.All the switches are foot level which can take awhile to get used to. The hose for attachments is very short - BUT the suction power is incredible!!  The man vacuum part is also very strong.I have low carpeting and don't switch from "bare floor" to "low carpet" and everything is vacuumed up.  Which is great because the dial to switch levels is in the front of the machine on floor level.  On/off and the level to I guess kneel the vacuum are also at the base towards the back and you just step on them.Nice little vac if you don't want to spend too much money.
Living room and bed room

The vacuum was okay. Worked great for about 6 months then slowly the suction got weaker and weaker. It stopped working properly about after 14 months, so I suggest to invest on a better vacuum cleaner.

Cord and vacuum hose too short to do serious cleaning. The vacuum is too high maintenance. Couldn’t get it to turn on so a closer look showed the start pedal wasn’t in place. If it happens a lot it could snap off.  Great suction power for a cheap vac. Would be good for a dorm or tiny low traffic apartment.

reviewTitle: Bulky, not easily maneuverable and high pitch whine
reviewDescription: I bought this in a rush when my other vacuum died on me one day and I wish I had shopped around more. This is bigger than my old vacuum, not as easy to turn and there is a high pitched whining noise when I use it. Also, I don't like that the brush doesn't turn off when you aren't moving the unit, for example, when you're using the handle to vacuum something up high or down low. I'm kind of hoping this dies out quickly so I can get something else. It does suck up a lot of dirt, so that's about the only positive.
Product is good. The cord is very short and doesn’t get anywhereVery disappointing.
You get what you pay for. This is cheaply made and not as powerful as something more expensive. Works ok for small jobs- like the office at work.

reviewTitle: One of the poorest vacuums I have ever purchased
reviewDescription: Yes this looks like a good product. I think it is poor at picking up on floor or carpet. The saddest thing is the belts break so easily. i have had three to break recently and will not replace. I am replacing the vacuum.
The vacuum doesn't have any suction power.  Waste of money.
It picks up hair very well and the dirt chamber is easy to empty but when you try and use the hose the vacuum falls over because it’s too light weight and the hose is too stiff.
Horrible.Don't buy!I normally love Eurekas.

this vacuum sucks it barely sucks anything up it just pushes the dirt away and then you’re vacuuming the same area for 20 minutes and keep finding more dirt because its just getting pushed somewhere else

reviewTitle: Not As EZ 2 Clean as the As One Model
reviewDescription: I was looking for a newer model similar to their washable As One model. This is okay and does a nice job; but, I got dirty trying to clean it; Eureka has made it so convoluted to take it apart! Why not stick with the As One design thats so much easier to take apart and clean?!? If you vaccum up dog hair, it gets stuck up inside the cup and doesnt fall out; so you have to dismantle the whole thing every time! I'll keep it. But I don't understand why these vacuum companies make such ridiculous designs! I guess the people who design them never vacuum or clean a house! They think, "that looks pretty cool and space age! Uhha uhha." Oh well...maybe someday...
Seems to be cheaply made but ok for the price. Gets the job done
Vacuum works good. Hose not long enough and pet suction is ok..

I have low carpet, put it on that setting and started to vacuum. It barely had enough power to spin the bristles, I honestly thought it was going to blow up. If the suction wasn't so good I would've given it less stars, but it at least had that going for it

For $87 it’s a halfway decent vacuum, considering what I really liked about this is the adjustable powerhead for carpets and other surfaces. But for the price, it kicks out dust and debris and it blows it around, so I don’t know how they can classify this as HEPA?

While this vacuum has decent suction and is easy to empty, if I had to do over, I'd spend more money for a better vacuum. Yes, it lightweight (easy to carry up the stairs) but if you are using the attachment tools don't expect it to stay upright. The stretch hose is too short so when you pull on it the least little bit, the vacuum tips over. Forget trying to vacuum your stairs with this thing. The electrical cord is SO SHORT. No going from 1 room to another without changing outlets. And the canister is too small especially if you have pets that shed.If you live in a very small apartment or house, and cost is a factor, then this may be for you. But if not, I suggest you look for a better model.  Sometimes being cheaper is too cheap. This one is going to the garage and I'll find a better one (more pros than cons) for my upstairs vacuum.
Purchased in February gone by July. Waste of money 💰

reviewTitle: Great suction but not much else
reviewDescription: The suction was great but the vacuum was cheap and the head popped loudly when you needed to start using it. I don't mind a vacuum that has plastic but this was the bottom of the barrel cheap in my opinion.
Good suction, light weight, cheaply made but for the price wouldn't expect better quality. My biggest issue is the high pitch whistling noise that won't stop. Very loud.

reviewTitle: It’s perfect for easy jobs. Get a new one every year and enjoy.
reviewDescription: Pretty good.

Super light weight, easy to get up and down stairs, I like that it's not big and heavy, nice quality. I wouldn't say it's extremely durable, but I've had no issues so far. Easy to use, simple and to the point. Works well.

I was surprised how well it worked for the price. The photo of the dirt in the dust cup is AFTER I just used my Dyson. Easy to put together, love bagless with lots of attachments. Will probably buy one for second floor.

reviewTitle: Eureka PowerSpeed: A Lightweight Cleaning Champion
reviewDescription: The Eureka PowerSpeed Upright Vacuum Cleaner is a pleasant surprise. Its lightweight design makes maneuvering around furniture and stairs a breeze without sacrificing suction power. It effortlessly tackles both carpets and hard floors, picking up dirt and debris with ease.I appreciate the multiple height adjustments, allowing for a customized clean on different surfaces. While the dust cup capacity is decent, frequent emptying might be necessary for larger homes or those with pets. Overall, the Eureka PowerSpeed is a reliable and efficient choice for maintaining a clean home without breaking your back.

This pet vacuum cleaner works fantastic!!! My sister recommended it liking it even better than her Dyson. And she was right!!! Fantastic price and fantastic product. Recommended to anyone looking for something affordable that works like something expensive.

With 3 dogs and carpet, OMG you just can't keep this place clean...........or can you!??!?! Holy bananas, this vacumn is amazzzing! Do you ever just come across a machine and think, ..where have you been all my life? I surely have found my right hand man in Eureka. 1. Shipped quickly 2. VERY lightweight, easy to manuevere 3. Attachments are perfect for cars, couches, stairs, and hard to reach places 4. Leaves awesome crispy lines across the carpet where you can absolutely tell that someone has vacumned!!! Don't think I don't use that one with my spouse when I am trying to win brownie points =) If you are looking for a cost effective, amazing option, this is it!! Thank you amazing Amazon!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
This vacuum is so lightweight. Very powerful. I was using an old heavy Hoover and this makes vacuuming so much easier.I love it!
Well-functioning vacuum picks up everything! Especially fur from my fluffy cat who sheds everywhere. So many options to clean all around the house.
