My daughter messed up my beloved Shark vacuum so I had to get a new vacuum. I didn’t want to spend that much again even though I love my Shark and have had many of them. I gave this a try based on the reviews. It’s just as good if not better than my Shark. I’m thrilled. Amazing quality, powerful and easy. We have two dogs, carpet, rugs, hardwood and it works perfectly on all surfaces.
So lightweight, easy to clean. Love the washable filters. Hair never gets trapped in rotating brush. Works so well.
Really like this product and works great would recommend and way to put together and easy to use use.

reviewTitle: Good suction, but primary accessory broke
reviewDescription: It’s got powerful suction and works great rolling the unit on carpets. The turbo attachment for pet hair literally just disassembled the first time I tried to use it. I think it was just manufactured poorly. I frustratingly tried to put it back together to no avail. I called Eureka and they gave me a lot of runaround. First, they wanted me to return the entire product to Amazon, which is obviously not easy because it’s a vacuum cleaner. Their warranty makes no mention of that but sounds like you deal with the company directly. I told them this is bull and that I simply want a replacement for the broken part, then they said “Well, then we will proceed.” I thought that pivot was odd to say the least. They sent me an email with my case number and I had to respond with model/serial numbers and photographs of the broken part. I’m still waiting for them to respond from there.UPDATE: dealing directly with the company, I was pretty clear I just needed them to send me a replacement part. Instead, they refunded the whole purchase price. Ummm, thanks. Once you start interacting with them over email, it’s hard to tell whether you’re dealing with a person or some AI bot. I don’t think they ever understood how simple my request really was. The vacuum and its other accessories work great.

reviewTitle: Works well but not for soft carpets
reviewDescription: I bought this because it had height adjustments and I needed a vacuum easier to push on my smart strand soft fiber carpet. With it set on the highest setting and the suction adjusted, it is still  VERY hard to push. It’s a fine vacuum but doesn’t meet my needs.

I liked that it was light weight worked poorly on carpet.  The flange that allows you to change the filter is hard to open.  In an older model it was a latch with a spring.  The bottom of the canister where the dust collect has grooves collecting fine dirt if you are not careful you have a mess on your hands.  the canister is smaller from my older Eureka pat vac. also set lower so if you are taller it is harder to push if you have back issues.  as far as having the handle that come out to attach the hose that is cool however it is very short.  So little help if you have something tallish to reach.  Works well on bare floors.
Dislikes:  Power cord too short, have to use extension cord. Using accessories is an "adventure", hose should be longer.Likes: Lightweight, good suction.

2 weeks in I had an issue with the belt - it will be a simple enough fix, though slightly inconvenient.Be careful to not overwork the vaccum in any way. I have just a small rug I use this on but didn't realize something got caught in the brush and it broke the belt quickly.In hindsight even with the user error I wish I had something smaller with more power behind it but for my budget, this is a good price and will do fine.

First of all I really like the vacuum cleaner it does clean my wood floors very well. It is loud as stated before but I don't care about that. The only problem I gave is the belt keeps slipping off while i'm vacuuming my area rug. I do adjust the vacuum cleaner for the correct height for the rug. But the belt still comes off and busting.  Then I have to take the bottom plate of the vacuum cleaner off . There are 6 screws to take out. Put a new belt back on, which is no easy task and then screw everything back in again. I really like the vacuum cleaner but I'm probably going to returning it because of this issue. Or either stock up on vacuum cleaner belts.
A nice vacuum for the price. A bit klunky & heavy but gets the job done.
This vacuum was powerful and the upholstery attachment was amazing. Had to return as it scratched our hardwood floors.

I bought this vacuum for the great reviews and found it worked great the first handful of times I used it but that changed very quickly. The suction is way less and it skips things regularly. It’s heavy and difficult to maneuver. I empty it after every use and I have checked for clogs or hair stuck on the wheel. It just lost quality quickly.

An excellent vacuum if you don't mind lugging around a 20# machine. On first vacuum, it picked up stuff its predecessor had left behind for months. I loved it, but I'm certain my 105# wife won't be able to use it.Owner's manual is ok, but it left out how to store the crevice tool—it attaches to the bottom cord hook.Overall, glad I bought it, but it's not for everyone.

This is my first time purchasing a vacuum from this brand.I wanted it to be lightweight, which is important to me.  It does feel extremely cheap compared to my last one.  Probably cheaper feeling than any vacuum I ever owned.I am not sure how I like the feel of it either when you are vacuuming carpet.  It doesn't seem to suction going forward, only when you pull it back towards you.  BUT I will say it vacuumed up more than my other vacuum ever did.  After I saw in the container how much it actually swept up I realized my other vacuum really didn't get much off the floor, even though it felt like it was.I am going to keep it, only because it was pretty inexpensive and seems to get the job done.The one thing I don't like is how you attach the hose when you need to use that.  It just seems backwards to me and I also don't like the main piece that you use to sweep.  I feel like it needs to be longer (without having to use attachments)Overall it will be fine and I like that you can just empty the container easily when it gets full.UPDATE:Now that I have had some time to use it, it is my least favorite vacuum I've owned.  The cord is too short and I find I have to keep switching plugs for it to reach.  I really don't like the hose feature that you use around baseboards, etc.  When you plug it in is is extremely loud, the vacuum is VERY loud in general.  I finished vacuuming the other day and my husband said, "why is that thing soooo loud??"I also realized it blows air out of the front of it!  I go to vacuum something and it starts blowing all over so I can't even get it.  So annoying.  I would recommend looking for a different vacuum!UPDATE #2I wish I would have returned it!  It gets worse and worse every time I use it.  The upper clip broke off that holds the cord when not in use, I swear it gets louder every time I use it, its obnoxious!  It also isn't picking things up as well anymore with the hose attachment.  I will need to buy a new vacuum soon, I can't deal with this one anymore!  I love vacuuming and this is taking the fun out of it!

I have mixed feelings about this vacuum because I was replacing my old one that I really loved and was looking for an upgrade. To be honest I was heavily disappointed because even though I read all the reviews I could no one mentioned what I'm about to mention.PROS- Has great suction power.- Comes with a lot of accessories that can be attached to the vacuum (no pieces laying around or getting lost).CONS- Not light weight. My arm ends up tired from carrying it and moving it around. Out of curiosity I put it on a scale and it weighs 12.5 lb, not 10 like advertised.- Too bulky. Doesn't fit into semi-narrow spaces or under most furniture. I end up brooming the room and collecting all the hair and dust in one place to then vacuum it (which defeats the purpose of having a vacuum).- The electricity cord is placed in a way that makes it harder to keep out of the way. The vaccum is always either rolling over or sucking it.- Comes with a hose that is too rigid and not flexible enough. Every time I use it I end up holding the hose with one hand and the vacuum with the other one so it doesn't fall to the floor.- That same hose, gets detached pretty easily. So I find myself holding the vacuum from the hose's attachment to help it from falling and from detaching.- It doesn't have any headlights (I find this particularly helpful since I have a golden retriever who sheds blond hair that is difficult to see and a light helps me identify what spots I've missed).- It has so much power that the air that comes out of it through the vent makes all the dirt and hair fly around when you're getting close to it (so you actually end up chasing it).

DO NOT BUY! I bought this vacuum cleaner as I have a dog that sheds a lot. The suction power was good and picked up the hair fine. The issue I had was when vacuuming the bathroom the rug got caught up in the brush. I immediately turned it off and got it unlogged. After that the brush would not come back on. I looked everywhere for a reset button only to find out it does not have one. I called Eureka customer service, told them what happened, they put in a reference number and told me to call Amazon. I then called Amazon who called Eureka on a three way call. This time when speaking to a rep at Eureka they stated they see where I had just called and told me it was my fault the vacuum quit working and there was nothing they would do. I was just out the $100 I spent and had only had the vacuum for 1 week. Needless to say I was angry to think I spent $100 on a vacuum I got to use 1 time. I have never had a vacuum that didn't have a reset button. You can't tell me that you have never sucked something up in a vacuum before..a sock, blanket, rug, etc. Luckily, the Amazon customer service person stepped in and asked them twice "are you saying you are not covering the warranty on the vacuum" in which, the Eureka person stated "we will not as it was her fault"! Amazon then hung up with them and proceeded to take care of the return for me through them and gave me my money back. I will NEVER purchase anything from Eureka again! I took the money from the return and bought the "Bissell Swivel Pet reach". It was about $30 more but well worth the money after this ordeal.

As a mom of 9 I wanted something that would work on hardwood floors as well as area rugs…this did not hold up. I used the vacuum a total of 4 times…husband used it once…I turned it on yesterday and noticed the brush was not spinning anymore…complained to husband about it and found that the drive belt for the brush had nearly been worn in half!!  While it will still suck-seeing the brush not move leaves me feeling unclean bc I expect ALL of the options to work. After walking on floors I noticed that it left thread and hair as well as small debris not only on my thread-bare area rugs but also on my hardwood floors.I do have to say the wand has a nice suction to clean furniture but the reach is less than ideal…I guess I now have a doorstop that can reach arms length areas…while fighting the vacuum to stay upright.All in all TOTALLY LESS THEN THRILLED WITH THIS PURCHASE!!!

reviewTitle: So many problems, ended up returning
reviewDescription: I had high hopes for this vacuum but it was so awful that I had to return it.Cons:- The base is too lightweight so when you use the extension wand, the whole vacuum just falls over and the brush roll is still spinning trying to suck everything in its path- The brush roll doesn't shut off when using the extension wand or hose, so it ended up sucking up part of an area rug and ruined the edge of it- All of the materials and base of the vacuum felt like cheap plastic- Wand and hose are really short and you end up having to bend over most of the time- The filter is extremely hard to clean, it's not as simple as opening the hatch at the bottom. Hair and dirt get trapped in the upper portion of the canister which then you need to unscrew and clean it out- You can change the height of the vacuum, but they are all pretty much the same and I saw no difference on what height you use- Didn't pick up any debris, lint, hair, etc. - which is the whole point of a vacuumPros:- Lightweight

This vacumum is lightweight and the electric cord is marginally long enough. However, I don't feel it is of good quality. I primarily have hardwood floors throught my home with a few carpet runners scattered about. While on the hardwood floors, rather then the vacumum sucking up the dust, I can actually see the dust being blown away, toward the front, from the machine. In order to achieve a reasonably good result, I have to vacumum over and over again and it still doesn't do a good job. Vacumuming carpet, it doesn't even pick up my cat hairs. My broom and dust pan does a better job. I called customer service. The machine is put together correctly. Customer service said send it back. To me, it's not worth the effort. I feel this machine is a piece of junk and will go out with my trash. Would I recomend this machine, no. I would give it "0" stars if I could.

I know this is a cheap vacuum, but the reviews were decent and I needed it more for the attachments than for vacuuming, as I have a cordless Dyson. First thing is that it tips...it's so light and flimsy that there's no weight to it...so I found I had to be careful so the thing wasn't falling on me or the furniture. But I figured I could live with that...especially since I mostly use my Dyson and have only used this four or five times since I bought it. The other day I wanted to vacuum the edges of my living room carpet and when I was done, and moved the vacuum off my off-white carpet, there was a huge black mark. At first I thought it was grease, but when I felt it the edges were crispy like they were burnt. I looked at the bottom of the vacuum and didn't see anything, but my husband looked at it again and the roller brushes at one end were hard and burnt. Turns out the roller brush, which is supposed to stop when you use the hose, does not stop and heated up and burnt the carpet. We also realized that the brushes are still turning on the bare floor setting as well...so this vacuum is clearly defective and we are past our return window. Found another spot on my hall carpet where it happened as well, but thankfully that spot is almost unnoticeable because the carpet is darker. I am absolutely livid, because I don't think my white carpet is fixable, so this cheapo vacuum is going to wind up costing me thousands, because I now have to replace two matching rooms of carpet. I will be calling Eureka corporate on Monday, but just wanted to warn buyers about this piece of junk. I will never buy another Eureka product again.

Honestly I bought this because my vacuum broke and I just needed something that would help get the dog hair up because I have 5 large dogs who shed a lot. I knew it wasn’t great but I didn’t want to waste money on something nice that would break due to use. However I’ve only had this for a couple of months and it won’t turn off. The only way I can get it to turn off is by unplugging it. The hose is small and doesn’t have great reach, the cord is short so I have to plug it in to different outlets to be able to reach a vast area. And the fan on it just blows dust and dog hair around before I can get it sucked up because of its placement. I’ll never buy it again and I wouldn’t recommend it to anyone

reviewTitle: Looks and works like a $30 vacuum
reviewDescription: I was so excited to own this brand again having had to deal with much cheaper versions for a while but I actually cried when I used it.I became ill shortly after getting it and have missed the return window.Not only does it not work very well, mind that we're talking about new carpet, but it emits a horrible high pitched noise. The noise seems to be getting better with use but I still have to wear my son's noise canceling headphones when I use it.It got clogged with pet hair after maybe 10 minutes, thought maybe there was just that much even thought the carpet was only 6 months old and we only have 1 cat and it would get better after a bit and started vacuuming twice a day. That didn't make any difference. If anything it's getting worse.My husband only used it once a day while I was sick but we have 1 cat that doesn't shed much by breed and there is a no shoes in the house rule since the new carpet, this shouldn't be a thing.Same thing every day, vacuum for about 5 or 10 minutes, there's no swirling action, empty cup, reach in and pull out a glob of yuck and start the process over.I never thought I'd be saying this about a Eureka but DO NOT BUY

I spent HOURS comparing vacuums and I’m not sure why this one has even one good review. Back to the drawing board I go because this vacuum is absolutely awful. Let’s start with the weight, which is supposed to be a selling point. It’s so light because the pieces are complete crap. It’s all put together by Lego duplo pieces. You know the big, light Lego pieces for toddlers?? Yes. Those.The hose sticks onto the thing with the security of a post-it note, so I’m sure the tiny stuff you vacuum just blows back out at you from one of the two “connections.” I wouldn’t know because the piece of work gave up on me after about 30 minutes of use. I did my bathroom floor, then the roller part literally stopped working when I started on my bedroom. The height/floor selector is so funny-looking and feeling… it literally feels like you are operating a children’s toy vacuum. Oh yeah, I can’t forget the fact that the light never worked. Brand new… never turned on for a second. First and last Eureka product… will never purchase anything from this brand ever again.

I take very well care of things and I don’t have super dirty rug nor did I have a challenging task at all for this vacuum. I just upkeep once a week m6 bedrooms with rug. This vacuum has barely any suction and it smells like something is burning when it’s on. Nothing has been sucked up the vacuum besides dander. My dog doesn’t shed and I don’t have toys or anything lingering. It did not meet my expectations at all. It was very short lived. I will pay the extra money for a shark vacuum.

I bought this vacuum specifically for dog hair as the reviews were great. Was amazing the first use. The 2nd time the motor made a terrible winding noise with an awful smell and shut off never to turn on again. Last the return date so now I have to contact the manufacturer. Bought a cheap $40 Walmart vacuum in the meantime that I’ve used on the same floors no issues. Would not buy again.

This is an embarrassing product for Eureka. After using this vacuum for 15 minutes in my living room and bathroom, I immediately repackaged it and an sending it back. Thin plastic wheels, weak suction, and a short extension hose are just a few of the strikes against this vacuum. The adjustment knob that has 5 settings from a high pile carpet down to a bare floor is a joke.  On its bare floor setting the front end drops to the floor leaving no room to roll over debris to suck it up, but instead just pushes debris like a snow plow because the front is touching the ground. And because it's touching the ground and because it's made entirely out of plastic with no rubber anywhere, dropped down to the bare floor setting just scratches the floor. The wheels have no rubber treads so it's just hard plastic scraping against the varnish on the floor. I tried raising the adjustment height one notch up so the vacuum has enough height to roll over debris but the suction power is so weak that it can't suck anything up and misses even the tiniest debris. Now while the vacuum itself is lightweight, this poses an issue when trying to use the extension hose. With the extension hose being short and the vacuum being lightweight, as soon as you pull the hose to get those "hard to reach places", the vacuum topples over because they're isn't enough weight to keep it upright. Terrible choice for hardwood floors, but thankfully Amazon allows returns.

reviewTitle: Not lightweight. Doesn't pick up anything on carpet
reviewDescription: I have had this vacuum for a few months and was talked out of returning it. Not sure what all the other raving reviews are talking about. I have chronic shoulder pain now because of how hard this vacuum is to maneuver on my carpet. And it doesn't pick up anything off the carpet either, no matter what setting it is on. Every single time I use it on the carpet, I have to pick up pieces of lint and fuzz myself that the vacuum refuses to pick up. Or lint roll them.

A day after my 30 day warranty the suction cup stop sucking. I have sent the company pictures of my invoice and the date of purchase blah blah blah and they are saying it still not enough very very upsetting
I purchased this vacuum for our new home, use it once and now it doesn’t work. The outlet works fine but the vacuum is not. The return time has expired now I’m stuck with this junk.

reviewTitle: Nothing Powerful or Turbo About This Vacuum
reviewDescription: Terrible vacuum. I should have known better, but wanted to save some money on this purchase. I am now going to have to buy a new one AGAIN. I'm sticking with a Shark vacuum. My last one picked up SO much. This ones brush doesn't even move on its own. It's manual so it only moves a little while I'm pushing it. Doesn't even leave tracks in my carpet. I hate it.
This tool doesn't work, it doesn't spin and then you take it apart to make it spin and the whole thing falls apart.  I'm so pissed!  my husband fixed it but it should not have been broken

This vacuum blows everything you try to vacuum up away from the vacuum. You will need to dust after using this thing. Awful! Real awful if you have pets, even thought it’s supposed to be good for pet hair.

Even after adjusting the height dial, we could not find a setting that sufficiently cleaned our carpet (low pile). It was ok on hard floor, but would leave a pile of dirt after the vacuum was shut off.
Belts on this model break frequently.  Even using their branded belt, was able to use for less that 1 hour before rollers stop turning.

This vacuum lasted me 4 months before breaking. The band just completely snapped and my husband thinks the manufacturer put it on wrong. I've never been down a vacuum so quickly. Will never buy this brand again.

I don't understand why they don't think these things through when they make stuff. Number one. The cord is too short. Number two. The hose is too short as well. Every time you  use it, it's falling over hitting you in the back. Can't reach anything to clean. What's the point of having a vacuum if you can't use it for anything ?? Very inconvenient. I'm sending it back.

reviewTitle: Terrible. It sucks geat, it collects tons of dirt, but
reviewDescription: Terrible. It sucks geat, it collects tons of dirt, but It is extremely hard to push. I've had it for 9 months now and I've hated it since day one. I love how much dirt it gets  but it is set too low from the factory, or something is wrong with it so it is very hard to push forward. I tried all the adjustments etc and I looked for anything broken, nada. It's just super hard to push forward. Backwards towards me is fairly ok but even on the highest carpet setting it is way too hard to push forward and makes my arm sore after 10 min. This pos will be going to the garage sale

reviewTitle: Worst vacuum I have ever owned
reviewDescription: I wish I didn’t have to give this vacuum any stars! With the overwhelmingly loud sound it makes you would think it’s doing something. First, it has a fan on the front of it that blows anything out and away from you as you move across the floor making it useless.Second but very important if you use the attachments it blows what little dirt and hair out of the opening that you have left when using the hose. Terrible product/design! Do not buy this!

This is the worst vacuum I have ever used. Every time I turn it on, it releases a cloud of dust, even after cleaning. If I go over hard floor, it does not pick up anything and blows debris around. On carpet I have to go over the same spot 3-5 times. Any hair gets stuck in the intake port, requiring frequent cleanings mid-use. The hose is difficult to use and the pet hair attachment is entirely non-functional. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY.

Terrible vacuum. I have 2 small dogs and 3 elementary school aged kids and this thing can’t even pick up a piece of paper.The only reason I never returned it was bc of the “cool” handle features. Even that is not as strong as I wish it to be.Thankfully I still had an older vacuum in the closet- that is my go to!
It burned up after 1 1/2 months of use, the motor started smoking and now it is trash.

reviewTitle: What good is suction if the exhaust blows up the dust before the area is vacuumed
reviewDescription: Unfortunately, suction for my 9lb shark only lasted a year, so I replaced it with Eureka Lightweight Powerful Upright Vacuum Cleaner for Carpet and Hard Floor a little over a month ago.Although the suction is great, the exhaust is somewhere up front, so it blows the dust up, right before you vacuum the area.  It is very clunky to maneuver, sucks up (with the brush) the corners of my area rugs and is much heavier than my old vac.  It is loud and did I mention, clunky?The extension tube is very short and so is the bent handle, which makes it impossible to vacuum under the furniture.  The vacuum also keeps on tipping over when using the extension.  By the way, the brushes continue to spin despite the fact that the extension is in use.Emptying it out causes a cloud of dust and you have to wipe the bin after emptying because the dust gets all over the bucket.The only PRO is that it is under $100 lol.  I should have known better.... really hade this piece of equipment.

I've had this thing for less than 3 months. I've maybe used 6 times. Today, I go to vacuum the couch and smells hot. So, I take apart enough to get the roller out, clean that, put the vacuumn back together turn it on and now sparks flying. This is beyond ridiculous!Don't waste your money! Save up a little and buy a shark.

I COULD NOT BE MORE DISAPPOINTED! I HAVE USED IT 3 TIMES NOW AND WILL NOT USE IT AGAIN. THIS VACUUM MAKES YOU WORK FOR IT!! THE SUCTION ON THIS VACUUM IS HORRIBLE FOR FLOORS. IT DOES NOT PICK UP PET HAIR, DUST, SPECKS OF DIRT OR ANYTHING ON THE FLOOR THAT CAN GET BLOWN AROUND. WHEN YOU TRY TO VACUUM IT UP - THE AIR FROM THE VACUUM SUCTION BLOWS IT AWAY - YOU HAVE TO KEEP CHASING YOUR PET HAIR AND SPECKS TO TRY TO VACUUM IT UP. GOOD LUCK WITH THAT! TOO MUCH WORK WITH NO REWARD OF CLEAN FLOORS.

We have owned several vacuums over the years, and remember when they actually had metal pieces! We have dealt with the cheap uprights and even bought a Dyson once (one of the top worst vacuums we have owned). This vacuum is by far the overall worst.It is extremely cheap, thin plastic which lends to the lightweight part, however this also seems to cause issues with the height adjustments, as they did not work at all. Trying to vacuum over a flat oriental rug was a joke - vacuum would not budge forward on ANY setting (because the height settings did not change) and we had to drag it backward over the rug, pick up the vacuum, place where we wanted to begin and drag backward...over and over.For the regular carpet, it was barely leaving tracks where I had vacuumed, once again, on ANY height setting. We did look the height leveler and it was not working.Got on Amazon chat, and CS approved a return and refund asap.Not sure why this thing received good reviews, or maybe we just got a Lemon. Either way, will not be buying the same one again.

Do not recommend. Very disappointed. I was using the hose feature when the vacuum ran over the cord accidentally  and shredded the cord. I filed a damage request because it was under warranty (5 times) and my only response was to submit photos again.For background, I am a behavior therapist in a school and a common training I do is to teach children how to use vacuums at home. I am well aware not to run over vacuum cords but this was a freak accident and it shredded it under 10 seconds. I do not recommend this vacuum

Unfortunately this is one of the worst vacuums I have purchased. It doesn’t suction or clean up anything very well. It just shoots the dirt everywhere and once you stop vacuuming it just leaves a pile of the dirt on the floor. I don’t recommend and will be switching back to Dyson.

At first I was happy with this vacuum. But after using it about 3 times I have come to really dislike it! When you use the removable wand, and you are trying to reach high places or low nooks and crannies, it doesn't do justice,  it either doesn't reach, or it falls over. Also being an owner of dogs and cats, it just blows the hair around and you get to play chase the furball, without the fun! And of course since I have used it, I can't return it! So now I am stuck with this POS vacuum!

reviewTitle: Not great at vacuuming and very loud.
reviewDescription: This vacuum was a disappointment. It is very loud and not good at vacuuming. I will be ordering a different brand 3 weeks after I bought this one.

Used three times, two belts broke and we have 80% tile in our house. A couple low rugs and 8 year old construction grade carpet in two bedrooms. Thankfully Amazon is so great on returns. Too bad too because attachments fit great and probably would have been very useful.

reviewTitle: It destroys belts quicker than it picks up dirt
reviewDescription: I don’t have much carpet in my house. It worked well for about a month. Now every time I use it the belt basically melts off. Not worth the hassle. The extra pieces for cleaning don’t stay in their holders. Disappointed to say the least. Waste of money!

Delivered without foam filter. As per instructions contacted Eureka to correct problem. They were out of filters until at least end of August. (Now July 9) Eureka advised I contact Amazon and send the unit back. Why would Eureka send out a product with part of it missing???

Bought this a few months ago, worked like normal until the last couple of weeks. It shoots out dust when powering on and can’t figure out why. Took apart everything cleaned it, and it still shoots dust from time to time. Never buying this garbage again.

Right out of the box the unit just feels cheaply made, low quality. Works ok but the turbo pet tool attachment didn’t work at all and after several exchanges with manufacturer customer service they wouldn’t even replace the one small piece, just went straight to telling me to return the whole thing. Nightmare to deal with. Not worth the price tag. Returning👎🏻Don’t buy eureka, they s*ck

This is the first review I’ve written on Amazon, but I feel I have to. I bought this vacuum because it has great reviews, but I found it only works on high carpet, and even then I have to go over areas twice. On harder surfaces, I can see it spewing dust from the sides of the brushroll, leaving plumes of dust in the air. I am very disappointed I spent any money on this and wish I had bought a different vacuum.

It has power, but is super LOUD!The beater bar runs nonstop and the hose is short.  It needs another pole attachment to reach low places without having to bend over, and I have to lift it up to reach the ceiling.  When I lift it up, I have to be careful that the beater bar doesn't catch the bottom of my shirt or dress.  This happened twice and the third time it happened, the belt broke.  Now I have to get a new belt.  I should have known that the price was too good to be true for a quality vacuum. I will now only buy a vacuum at a store, where I can really check it out, before purchasing it.  It's hard to feel comfortable returning something after getting it dirty!

reviewTitle: Sucks, in more ways than one
reviewDescription: It’s a light compact vacuum that when I plugged in offered good suction. It arrived super late but that’s an Amazon issue that was never resolved and as a result I’ve only used it for a bit over a month.  The brush wheel no longer turns making it useless as an upright vacuum. Other people mentioned the same. I should’ve paid attention. The second time I used it I smelled burning rubber. The attachment system is flawed as is the hose connection. I was able to work around that but not the rubber band that makes it go on the floor or carpet. It’s cheap for a reason.

Originally I was going to rate this 5 stars!  Just a short time after using the product one of the accessories fell off and just broke into 10 pieces or so.  I contacted Eureka immediately and sent them everything they requested.  They are now not responding to my request for updates.

reviewTitle: Don't buy this. Worst vacuum I have ever owned
reviewDescription: I basically used this 3-4 times and couldn't return it so I just left out with garbage hoping someone didn't pick it up and then experienced what I did. Pushing the vacuum is like trying to move a tank. Rollers get immediately clogged, hose to container clogged, terrible suction in all kinds of situations. Short carpet, long carpet, and hardwood floors. Terrible just simply terrible. I did a back and forth on 2 pictures included and you can see the results. Terrible!

reviewTitle: If you buy this, plan on getting a new one yearly....
reviewDescription: It's been a year since I purchased this vacuum.  I have two long haired cats.  I will admit this was great for picking up the hair, so kudus for that. However, after emptying and cleaning the cannister out last time, I screwed in the interior top part (where the screws are) like I always have done and now I cannot get the two pieces to unscrew.  I broke the plastic twist part as I was trying to loosen it, so the vacuum is now useless since I cannot undo the top piece to empty it or remove the fur.  The bottom latch part works fine.  This is a noisy vacuum and the hose is short and stiff, so that's an issue as well.  But for $80.00, don't expect it to last too long.

This vacuum certainly has powerful suction. So much so that it pulled up two of my area rugs and damaged the corner of one of them. The roller attachment stopped rolling as soon as I touched it to the sofa and was therefore useless. When I remounted it on the vacuum (after trying to get it to stay there many times), it finally fell off and broke into pieces. The hose is extremely short inflexlible., so you can't really do anything more than an arm's length away.  The cord is also very short (and I have a tiny house), and it comes out at the bottom of the vac, so you or the wheels are constantly getting tangled in it even if you tuck it in the little hook at the top. I am returning this item.

Used it as soon as it arrived…very flimsy and cheaply assembled…worked fine fir 29 minutes and all of a sudden was throwing dirt back out of roller area. Removed plastic cover and found broken plastic controlling height adjustment. Couldn’t get it back to UPS fast enough!!Price indicates it’s quality! Don’t buy!!!

I have purchased a number of vacuum cleaners in the 47 years of my adult life and this is by far the absolute worst one I have ever had. It doesn't pick up everything even with a few passes and leaves tracks of dust on the carpet. Never again!

The rotor brush stopped working and I checked for any jams or obstructions, none to be found. I have only used this vacuum less than a dozen times (8-9)I’m not very happy with the product.  And of course, my return date just passed a month and a half ago  🤦🏻‍♀️

I tried to give this vacuum cleaner a chance, but trying it out for almost a month, I want to throw it in the trash. When I use it, the vacuum does not suck well, it blow the dirt to the back of the cleaner. I had to turn around and suck it a few more times. I got to the point where I just use my broom for the hard floor. I would not buy this.
I waited all day for this item just for it to arrive and not work!It makes a weird noise when it on and it’s not even picking up trash.I’m extremely disappointed and will be returning it tomorrow.

reviewTitle: Stopped Working Second Time I Used It
reviewDescription: It worked great the first time I used it. I went to use it the next day and it was dead. Absolutely would not turn on. How are these products being made? Back it went. Complete waste of time and energy.

Worked great the first couple of times then spits out everything as soon as you turn off the power. I've connected everything as supposed to. Very cheaply made. After taking out 6 screws to unclog the vacuum and clean the brush thoroughly, I put it all back together to smell burning. The belt needed to be replaced just after using the vaccuum a few times! It’s worth spending more money on a vacuum that’s easier to use and maintain.

reviewTitle: This vacuum sucks and NOT like it should
reviewDescription: Go figure like 2 days after my 30 day return window the vacuum starts blowing out more than it sucks. WOW what a mess and total disappointment.What i may have saved in money is gonna cost me nothing but headaches and a paperweight that sucks horribly.

Wow, there is not enough words to speak about how absolutely horrible this vacuum is. It does an okay job and sucking, I have shag carpet and I just kept seeing little white things sitting on the carpet after going over it several times so its not great, at all at sucking. There is NO WAND, the little handle is the "wand" and the hose is like 4 feet long so had fun with that when I was trying to vacuum my couch. I was attempting to use the pet tool but as soon as you put the sloghtest pressure it stops spinning. Speaking of the hose, when you disconnect it from the unit, the vacuum keeps spinning and as the hose is super short, you are constantly lifting the unit and moving it, well, guess what?! The electrical cord gets sucked in and gets cut up. I have had this 3 days and I will never buy a Eureka again. I have never had one previously and now I know why. Also, keep the box. I made a makeshift box so I can return this big pile of garbage.

reviewTitle: Smells like it’s burning after less than 3 months of use
reviewDescription: Was a great vacuum at the start, but after some use it now smells like burning whenever we use it. We’ve went through everything and it appears the motor is overheating because everything else looks fine.

Chord too short, canister release button never releases in it's own, canister fills up roo fast and clogs up every use. When trying to use hose too short, vacuum tips over often.  Not for use in a 1,200 sq.ft. house. Maybe a small apartment. This vacuum has been used in a home that has no children, no pets and has 1 year old low pile carpet only in bedrooms.  The rest of house is hardwood and is always very clean. So,  for it to clog up everytime I use it, is a flaw. Bummed cuz I have only had eureka vacuums. This model has left me disappointed. I need a reliable efficient tool and this item is not that.

I have always purchased sharks but due to some unfortunate circumstances I had to use the vacuum (shark) that I had and I needed a new vacuum quickly so I bought this and it honestly is terrible! The belt has broke more than 3 times , I replaced it yesterday and the first time using it broke again!!!! Do not waist your money! I even reached out to the company and they said a belt should be replaced every few months and I don’t think that is exceptable!

reviewTitle: Broken after only 3 months- just skip it
reviewDescription: I would give this a zero if I could. I guess I should have known given the price. You get what you pay for. This vacuum didn’t suck right out of the box, there was always a burning smell, which are the top two questions when visiting the support page (yikes), and finally gave up the ghost in January. Took me this long to finally write the review.We have dogs, cats, carpet, area rugs, and laminate floors. Trying to get “support” is next to impossible. Eureka used to be a good brand. Maybe the more expensive vacs are better. Still searching for something that can do the job…..

This vacuum is the most inconvenient thing I’ve ever owned. Every time I try to use it it clogs up immediately. I tried to take a video after clearing out the three handfuls of dust and fur in it to show how fast the sound changed from normal to clogged BUT IT STARTED OFF CLOGGED SOMEHOW. At least I know not to buy from Eureka, that “filter” at the top is the worst design I’ve ever seen.

reviewTitle: I would not recommend this even to anyone including my ex...
reviewDescription: I don't think reviewing something like a vacuum can be done right away. I bought this in Oct 2022 of last year so I think this is a good time to review. I really wanted to like this. First off, the wheels are made from the cheapest plastic I have ever seen on a vacuum, and they have zero grip. They glide more than they spin on surfaces. The extension hose is too stiff for the machine which weighs a feather... When you use the hose, it will knock down the entire vacuum unless you have it up against something, which is super annoying.. When I vacuum my thin rug in my living room even on the highest setting I have trouble pushing it across the rug.  The suction barely picks up easy things like Cheerios from my toddler. This was the first and last time I plan on buying a vacuum online. Wish I would have just returned this and gotten my money back!
Roller bar DOESNT STOP!!! When upright and using wand.  Therefore, it sucked up its own cord!!!!!  Highest level on hard wood, it shoots debris instead of picking up!!!!

This vacuum is not really light weight.  No luck with this vaccum picking up the dirt from my tile floors.  I had to sweep after using the vaccum.  Vacuum also doesn't flow through my rugs even on the high carpet setting.  I'm very disappointed in the performance of this Eureka.

reviewTitle: Does not pick up or suction very well.,
reviewDescription: This vacuum is horrible, no matter what setting we put it on it does not suction very well. I do not recommend this product, do not waste your money.

At first I really liked this vacuum. When I first used it, it seemed to have a lot of sucking power. But unfortunately within just a couple of months the vacuum power significantly weakened and I could not figure out why. Nothing was clogged, filters clean. And now it just completely does not work at all. And I only purchased it in January. Just a complete waste of money. Do yourself a favor and just spend 50$ more dollars to get yourself a vacuum that will actually last. Now I have to buy a new vacuum again.

I bought this vacuum about six months ago. This thing couldn’t pick up a feather. I’m extremely unhappy with it. Sometimes it blows more dust and dirt out then it picks up. Maybe it was just the one I received but this vacuum does not suck. It’s worthless.

It arrived broken.  The nozzle of the handle would not stay in the base.  It would lock in place when the vacuum was in the upright position but would slide out when  inclined, making it impossible vacuum.  I contacted Eureka and went through several phone calls and did everything they asked.  They ended up telling me they did not have the part.  They suggested contacting Amazon for a replacement or return.  I wanted a replacement because it is lightweight and the suction seemed good, but Amazon did not have any in stock.  I am frustrated and very disappointed in Eureka!  The name used to insure quality.Update on 11/13/23:  Because of the runaround with Eukeka and a trip out of the country, I missed my return window.  Now I am stuck with a brand new vacuum that the handle won’t stay in.  I had to duct tape it to try to get the handle stay.  I would advise against this purchase.

Unfortunately, I just opened my vacuum cleaner and attempted to use it for my Easter weekend cleaning. What a joke at first I thought this is gonna be a great vacuum cleaner. There was very little assembly needed however when you place it on any heights or rugs or carpet, the vacuum cleaner will not move, it is not push able. My returnable window closed on March 21. And although I’ve used the vacuum cleaner once or should I say attempted to use the vacuum cleaner once it does not work and I am stuck with it.😡😡😡😡😡😡😡👎🏼👎🏼👎🏼👎🏼👎🏼👎🏼👎🏼👎🏼👎🏼👎🏼👎🏼

Should have checked the reviews more like insult do. But this is the worst vaccumed I ever purchased. I needed something quick and for the price I gave it a chance. This vacuum doesn’t even work properly. On hard floors and carpet it doesn’t not collect anything. Just shoots dirt and debris back out…. The only thing that’s “ok” is using the handle attachement to collect it all but that’s it. Also the vacuum is pretty big but feels so cheap and lightweight. Again I just needed a vacuum that exact day so it was a quick buy. Will not purchase again. If I could give this zero stars I would in a heart beat.

First off I've had the vacuum for less than a month and it quit working. So I'm returning. Of course o have to figure out how to box it up to ship back and wait for my refund.Other reasons for one star- this is made of very cheap thin Plastic. Also, the knob  to change for flooring is inconveniently placed making it a pain. Having used other vacuums to is is definitely a cheap base model .

reviewTitle: Does not work well,  even brand new
reviewDescription: I waited to write a review until after owning for a little while,  but this ranks up there as one of the worst I've ever owned. Brand new, first use had horrible suction.  It doesn't pick up everything,  will have to go over a spot a few times then I still have to pick up small things,  even pine needles on wood or tile aren't picked up easily.  The design makes pet hair get stuck at the top of the cannister regularly and the only way to get it out is to stick your arm up inside the cannister. It's gross and doesn't work, don't waste your money!!

Used it one day and it worked next time brush wasn’t turning.  Took bottom plate of to access belt.  Put it back on.  came right back off looks like it had a small piece off.  I am 70 years old had a hard time getting g back on don’t want a sweeper that belt comes off.  unfortunately my son-in-law threw box away don’t know if i can return it

I have had a Dyson for the past 10 years. I knew there would be a quality difference but man I poured over these reviews and saw so much positivity on this vacuum I was encouraged I felt like it might actually be a good one. It seems very popular that solid surfaces are what most people have. However, I needed a good vacuum for carpet. Didn’t want to spend a whole lot of money and I totally got what I paid for in this situation. This vacuum is awful, the hose doesn’t work when you turn the vacuum off debris comes out of the hose because there’s not enough suction to get it into the canister. There is a specific attachment that seems like would be so great. It looks like a little mini handheld vacuum that you put to your hose that does not work at all not at all again because there’s not enough suction. This vacuum is for pure novelty. So frustrating.

reviewTitle: ONLY BLOWS DUST AWAY. DOESN'T SUCK IT IN AT ALL.
reviewDescription: It's such a pain to use this vacuum. It's strong for a carpet maybe but if you have hard floor it only blows all the dirt and dust around and away from what's supposed to be sucking the dirt in. You then only breath in dust. It's so exhausting to get anything clean. I now only use my dustpan. Will have to buy a new one. Very disappointed - for this price it should at least work.

reviewTitle: Cheap, awkward, stopped working in 15 minutes
reviewDescription: There are a few flaws. The brush’s don’t ever stop spinning. So hardwood floors are impossible. I bought this because I spilled cat litter on my carpet. The ultimate test, which it rose to the occasion by emitting a plum of dust like a Sahara dust storm. Getting bogged down. Then the drive belt slipped off and the brush’s stopped working. What a bust of a product.I also found that the carpet attachment is driven by the flow of air instead of a motor. So it stalls on any carpet that is even remotely “shaggy”. With the hose wanting to fight me the entire time to return to its resting position.Save your money. I’m certain there is another vacuum of this price range that is vastly superior.

I used to sell vacuums and remembered good things about this brand. So I was disappointed when i got this model. I wish i kept the box to return it. it doesnt have good suction and misses easy messes even on hard floors. very loud and even on highest height setting it scratched my wood floor. Destroyed two rugs no matter how careful i was. the rollers are insane. literally trashing it now.

reviewTitle: Bought 2 years ago for very light use. Never worked well.
reviewDescription: I should have arranged for a return, but this item was purchased for a rarely used cabin shared by several people, and the message of a poorly working vacuum cleaner got lost.  Now that information is flowing, and the word is it never worked well, was missing some vital pieces for non-floor cleaning, and doesn't work at all now, 2 years and only a handful of uses later.  Of course, it's way too late to make any attempt for return, and that's on us.  But,  don't waste your money.

reviewTitle: You get what you pay for
reviewDescription: I took this to the dumpster after just 2 uses.  The roller brush completely stopped working....it was not clogged with hair.  My wife bought this as a replacement to our Shark, which we had for over 10 years.  The quality between the two brands does not compare.  We would have sent this back for a refund, but we threw away the packaging the day we got it.  After all, who buys a vacuum cleaner expecting to return it after the second use?
This is the worst vacuum, it spits dirt all over, because the roller can’t be turned off. Don’t waste your money! It is also very hard to push on even short carpet.

After reading the reviews I thought this was a pretty safe choice. I was wrong. When I turned it on it made a very high pitched ear splitting sound that never stopped. Sounds like it's coming from the motor. I tried every trouble shooting idea I could find online. Nothing helped. I called the Eureka help line. They were totally worthless. Also the hard floor and carpet adjustments suck. On hard floor the brushes hit the floor. To vacuum any rugs you have to change it to the highest setting or it will eat the rug. The adjustment knob is very inconveniently placed. You have to stop vacuuming, put it in the standing position,  bend over and turn it. Should be a foot pedal.My ears are ringing after using it for a little while. No choice but to return it and try a different brand.
I have had this 4 months. Now no suction. I'm an older person in small space with NO carpet and still it has fizzled out. Unfortunately I'm too late to return. DONT BUY
Every time I use the vacuum for light household cleaning, the belt comes off the brushroll and it quits rotating (and has no suction power). I highly regret spending money on this product.

I bought this vacuum in May, I used it two times and I was shocked by how good the suction was. On the 3rd use suction was very low, today is the 4th time am using it the suction remains low. I checked to see if the hose is blocked, nope. I can't return it because its past the return date. Such a waste!

We had this vacuum for a few weeks, used a handful if times. Everytime I used it, the belt would come loose and not work the brush. After the 4th time fixing it, the little metal piece that helped hold the belt broke off at some point while using the vacuum so now it doesn't work at all and is not something I can replace. This vacuum was lightweight, but appears cheaply made. I've never had a vacuum have this issue.

I'm not sure how people are rating this good for animal hair.  The vent is faced forward.  As you push this, it blows animal fur away from the vacuum and all around the room.  This has to be one of the worst designs I've seen in a product.  One use and we returned it.  What silliness.

For the money, you get what you pay for.  For the Quality, you also get what you pay for. I've loved the big retaining container, but disapprove of the short cord. Found dog hair coming out of the vacuum cleaner around the solid parts was a little concerting. Thew dust, particles throughout the rooms and I was dusting more. I would not buy this ever again, but I did take this vacuum cleaner and throw it in the trash.
Doesn’t do its basic job which is to vacuum. Just spits up debris and the hose has zero suction. I know it’s cheap but it lasted one month?!

reviewTitle: Worst vacuum I've ever had, don't waste your money
reviewDescription: This worked "ok" the first two uses. Then stopped sucking anything up. Took it apart, found there was no filter, and the belt was in pieces. I feel I wasted money trying to find an affordable vacuum and should have just spent more on the one a little more expensive but proven that it works. VERY DISAPPOINTED
